entry.title: SAP Ariba Supplier Management & Risk 2508 Release Key Innovations Preview
entry.content:
Supplier Management Integration with WalkMe (SLP-2265)
This feature integrates SAP Ariba Supplier Lifecycle and Performance and SAP Ariba Supplier Information and Performance Management (new architecture) with WalkMe Digital Adoption Platform. Users can take advantage of easy-to-understand guidance powered by WalkMe.

Supplier Management WalkMe integration includes several standard smart walk-throughs from SAP Ariba for common workflows. Customers can also choose to develop their own content by first purchasing WalkMe Premium for SAP Ariba solutions. For more information about WalkMe Premium for SAP Ariba solutions, see https://walkme.com

If you have an SAP Companion help system enabled, its help content remains available.

View implementation details and more here.

 

AI Copilot Joule in Supplier Management (SLP-2258)
Joule, SAP's generative AI copilot, is now available in supplier management. Joule uses a conversational interface to help users complete tasks efficiently. It leverages generative and other AI technologies to understand natural language requests, identify intent, perform actions, and provide insights. Using generative AI, it can execute tasks, deliver tailored responses, and summarize information effectively.

(IMPORTANT: AI Copilot Joule in SAP Ariba Supplier Lifecycle and Performance will be in early access until September 19th, 2025, at which time it will be made generally available to customers.)

View implementation details and more here.

For the list of tasks that you can perform using Joule, refer to the topic Joule Capabilities in Supplier Management.

 

Displaying Comments when Updates are Requested for a Modular Questionnaire (SLP-2272)
Modular questionnaires allow continuous updates or permanently close after the submitted answers are first approved or denied. Requesting an update reopens the questionnaire so that the recipient can update it once. When you request an update to a modular questionnaire and enter an (optional) comment about the update request, the comment along with its timestamp is now displayed in the Comments section of the modular questionnaire.For example, the comment is displayed in this manner: "UserXYZ has requested an update for questionnaireABC".

View implementation details and more here.

 

Option to Join the SAP User Research Panel (SRISK-1771)
This feature provides you an option to join the SAP User Research Panel, where you can share your thoughts and ideas to enhance SAP Ariba Supplier Risk and other SAP products you currently use.

View implementation details and more here.

 

Supplier Risk Engagements API Retrieves Inherent Risk Screening Questionnaire Information (SRISK-1415)
This feature introduces a new version of the Supplier Risk Engagements API. In addition to the other existing capabilities, this new version lets you retrieve questionnaires, answers, and answer types of inherent risk screening questionnaires to provide better insights to plan your organization's operational needs.

View implementation details and more here.

 

SAP Ariba Supplier Risk Integration with WalkMe (SRISK-1714)
This feature integrates SAP Ariba Supplier Risk with WalkMe Digital Adoption Platform. Users can take advantage of easy-to-understand guidance powered by WalkMe.

View implementation details and more here.

 

Supplier Risk Engagements API Retrieves Domain-Based Residual Risk Score (SRISK-1731)
This feature enables Supplier Risk Engagements API to retrieve domain-based residual risk score for Information Security, Data Privacy, and Compliance domains at the control, engagement, and supplier levels.

View implementation details and more here.

 

Risk Exposure Summary Report Displays Overall Residual and Inherent Risk Levels (SRISK-1763)

This feature provides information about the inherent and residual risk levels of suppliers in the Risk Exposure Summary report. This crucial information aids in making informed decisions when engaging with suppliers.

In addition to the existing risk exposure information, the Risk Exposure Summary report now includes two additional columns to provide inherent and residual risk level information for the suppliers you monitor in SAP Ariba Supplier Risk.

Changes to the User Interface - Currently, the Risk Exposure Summary report summarizes the overall risk exposure, and category-wise risk exposure such as legal and regulatory, environmental and social, and operational risk exposure. This enhancement introduces two additional columns to display overall inherent risk level and residual risk level information for the suppliers you monitor in SAP Ariba Supplier Risk.

View implementation details and more here.

 

Stay connected with our community for more insights and updates:

  • Register for the Early Release Series for 2508 release (August 12-14, 2025)

entry.title: SAP UX Q3/2025 Update – Part 6: SAP Customer Experience and SAP Concur
entry.content:
This sixth post in my series gives an overview of user experience innovations in SAP Customer Experience and SAP Concur. For SAP Customer Experience, look at the new AI agents and the capability to build custom agents, plus AI innovations for marketeers in SAP Emarsys, and Joule and AI order summaries in SAP Sales Cloud Version 2.  SAP Concur takes travel planning to the next level with the whole new travel experience, complemented by the new Joule Booking Agent enabling users to use natural language to book a trip.

Before reading this, do read the first blog post introducing the series and providing general information about Joule and central entry points and services, along with links to all the published parts of this blog post series:

  • SAP UX Q3/2025 Update – Part 1: AI, Joule, SAP Build Work Zone, SAP Mobile Start.

 

SAP Customer Experience

The user experience highlights I have picked are all AI-related:

  • AI Agents.
  • SAP Emarsys UX innovations.
  • SAP Sales Cloud Version 2 UX innovations.

This news article summarizes what’s new overall for SAP Customer Experience, beyond UX-related innovations:

  • Connected for Growth: What’s New with SAP Customer Experience in Q2 2025.

AI Agents

As I explained in part 1 of this series, AI agents work in the background to give a greatly enhanced user experience. A number of powerful AI agents are available for SAP Customer Experience, via the package Joule Premium for Customer Experience. This blog post and video give a nice overview of three of them in action:

  • AI Agents in Action.
  • Video: See How AI Agents Streamline Customer Service (3:11 min.)

The latest UX innovations are:

  • Shopping Agent for the Shopping Assistant.
  • Digital Service Agent (via Early Adopter Care program).
  • Ability to create custom agents in the CX AI Toolkit.

AI Shopping Agent for the SAP Commerce Cloud Shopping Assistant

The shopping agent helps customers when visiting an online shop: they can simply use natural language to state what they are looking for, and the shopping agent will respond with suitable suggestions. Figure 1 shows an example, where the user starts out by stating that they are looking for shoes to wear for two mile long walks while wearing a suit. Two shoes are suggested, and the user asks which one is comfortable right away, since he doesn’t want a long break in period. The agent recommends one model, and the customer then asks for a recommendation for a belt to match, which the agent promptly gives him.

Figure 1: Shopping Agent for the Shopping Assistant from SAP Commerce Cloud. Alt Text: three screenshots of a tall and narrow screen showing a chat, one for each of the interactions explained in the main text. Each response shows one or two images: in the first case two shoes, then one shoe and then one men’s belt.

Find out more here, and watch the video embedded there to see it in action:

  • SAP Discovery Center: Shopping Agent

Digital Service Agent

The new digital service agent helps to provide your customers with a great user experience, similar to how the shopping agent is aimed primarily at your customers. It enables customers to ask questions with natural language and provides answers based on your company’s business knowledge residing in the SAP system. Hence, it is able to resolve common inquiries and issues, giving customers a good experience. Furthermore, by freeing up you sales and service team to focus on more complex inquiries, your customers will also receive a better service and hence better experience.

The digital serice agent is currently only available for select customers via the Early Adopter Care program. Figure 2 in the next section shows how these customers can select it in the AI Agent Builder.

Find out more here:

  • SAP Discovery Center: Digital Service Agent.

Create Custom Agents with CX AI Toolkit

You can now create your own custom agents with the CX AI toolkit. Figure 2 shows the start screen for the AI Agent Builder, where you can select “Custom Tool” to start the wizard which takes you through the steps to create a custom agent.

Figure 2: The AI Agent Builder in the CX AI Tookit for creating custom AI agents or using SAP templates to create AI agents. Alt Text: A screenshot with “Let’s Create AI Agents” in large text in the middle below an illustration, below in much smaller text “Start by selecting an Agent Template”. Below that, two rows of three cards representing Agent Templates are shown: Custom Tool, Knowledge Agent, Classification Agent, Digital Service Agent, Q/A Agent, and Shopping Assistant Agent.

Find out more here:

  • Documentation: Create a Custom AI Agent.

Further Information on AI Agents for SAP Customer Experience

For a deeper understanding of the power of these AI agents, have a look at this longer video:

  • Video: SAP CX AI Toolkit: AI Insights Agents for SAP C4C & Shopping Assistant | Product Inspiration Series (32:21 min.)

SAP Emarsys

AI-Assisted Report Builder using Natural Language

You can now easily create a report using natural language to describe what you are interested in. Figure 3 shows an example of the entry screen. At the bottom you see hints on what kind of queries you can enter.

Figure 3: AI-assisted report builder in SAP Emarsys. Alt Text: A screenshot with “Unlock the Power of Data with the AI-assisted Report Builder” in the middle. At the top a text entry field containing the query “What are the Sent, Delivered, Bounced, Opened, Clicked, Purchased, Unsubscribed, Complained for my Email campaigns in the past month?”, to the right an AI button “Generate Report”. At the bottom of the screen two example queries are listed.

Once you have created the report, you can easily adjust it using a set of convenient filters, such as the date range as well as the list of campaigns and metrics. Watch this video to see it in action:

  • Video: AI-assisted Report Builder (46 seconds).

AI-assisted Product Finder using Natural Language (Pilot)

Pilot customers can now try out the new AI-assisted product finder, which allows users to search for product to add to marketing campaigns using natural language. Figure 4 shows an example of how to enter your search text, see more here:

  • Video: AI-assisted Product Finder (38 seconds).

Figure 4: AI-assisted product finder available to SAP Emarsys pilot customers. Alt Text: A screenshot showing a screen with a left half containing the Product Finder, with a search field containing “Most popular shoes in the last 6 month”, above an empty space with the text “Welcome to Product Finder!” in the middle. The right half shows an image of someone dancing in the sun and an image of a dress, along with some describing text.

Read more about latest SAP Emarsys innovations here:

  • SAP Emarsys Q2 2025 Product Release.
  • SAP Emarsys introduces new generative AI capabilities in June Product Release

SAP Sales Cloud Version 2

Joule in SAP Sales Cloud

Joule is now available in SAP Sale Cloud Verion 2, helping users get quick insights, for example about an account. As you can see in Figure 5, these insights can be charts as well as text based.

Figure 5: Joule for SAP Sales Cloud Version 2. Alt Text: A screenshot of Joule showing Customer Account Overview, with the text “Show Key Metrics” entered as chat, below which a card with a vertical stacked bar chart shows credit limit usage (remaining amount and exposure amount), below that a card showing Key Metrics (Activity) and part of a donut chart for Tasks, Phone Calls, Appointments, Visits etc.

Have a deeper look here:

  • Video: Intelligent Selling with Joule in SAP Sales Cloud & SAP S/4HANA Cloud | Product Inspiration Series (16:04 min.)

Sales Order Summary

The Sales Order Summary uses generative AI to summarize key information about the sales order, as well as including information about some changes, for example how the price compares to the original price. Figure 6 shows an example, with the insights shown on the left of the screen.

Figure 6: Sales Order Summary in SAP Sales Cloud Version 2. Alt Text: A screenshot showing a sales order, with the left third showing an overview with AI-generated insights such as “13 days past requested date”, “Overall discount is EUR 808.55”. On the right, the Order Summary tab is shown, with account name, net and gross value, pricing stats, above “Products in Cart (2)” showing a list of two products, followed by the top part of a list of pricing steps.

Learn more here:

  • Documentation: Sales Order Summary.

 

SAP Concur

The new Concur Travel experience makes it much easier to book travel involving multiple bookings, such as a flight plus hotel plus rental car. And if you just need to book one item, you can do that very easily now with the new Booking Agent powered by Joule.

New Concur Travel Experience

When travelling for a few days, one often needs to book more than one item. A typical combination is booking a flight, a hotel and a rental car. Up until now, you have had to book each item separately and take care that the dates and time match. Now, with the new Concur Travel experience, planning and booking is much easier: you can enter the start and end dates for your flight, and the new feature Match Flight Booking is applied to the hotel and car, so that dates and time match automatically.

Figures 7 to 11 show what this looks like: Figure 7 shows the start screen, where you select which items you want to include (flight, hotel, car, train). Figure 8 shows the flight view, where flight dates have been entered. Figure 9 shows the hotel search, with the default selection “Based on flight selection”, and similarly Figure 10 shows the rental car search, with pick-up and return times calculated based on the flight schedule. Figure 11 shows the finalize screen, in this case showing that the flight and hotel has been selected but the rental car is still open.

Figure 7: New Concur Travel experience start screen. Alt Text: A screenshot of a pop-over with a large image of a magnifying glass on a globe, above the text “Start Planning”. Below that four check boxes in a row: Flight, Hotel, Rental Car, Train, at the bottom “Continue” and “Cancel” buttons.

Figure 8: New Concur Travel experience screen with flight details. Alt Text: A screenshot showing a trip planning for a Trip to Las Vegas. The left third of the screen shows a list with items Flight, Hotel, Rental Car, with Flight selected. Below the list buttons “Add to trip” and “Search”. On the right a selector for round-trip (selected), one-way or multi-city, with fields for from / to locations and a date field for the stard and end date. To the right a button “Time preferences” and a drop-down for selecting “Cabin”.

Figure 9: New Concur Travel experience screen with hotel details. Alt Text: As for Figure 8, but with Hotel selected, and on the right Hotel Search displayed, with the fields for “Hotel, location, or name” and “Dates” filled with the text “Based on flight selection”.

 Figure 10: New Concur Travel experience screen with rental car details. Alt Text: As for Figure 9, but with Rental Car selected, and on the right Rental Car Search displayed, with the fields for “Pickup” and “Dates” filled with the text “Based on flight selection” and the field “Drop-off” filled with “Same as pickup”. Pickup Time and Drop-off Time fields have 10:00 AM entered.

Figure 11: New Concur Travel experience finalize screen. Alt Text: Screenshot showing “Trip to Las Vegas” on the left two-thirds, with a card summarizing the flight with United Airlines from San Antonio, TX (SAT) – Las Vegas, NV (LAS) and a card summarizing the hotel Courtyard by Marriott Las Vegas. The right third shows the Estimated Total Cost $2497.85 above a list with the cost of each item (flight, hotel, rental car), and buttons for “Finalize Trip” and “Cancel Trip”, and options to book anything else (Flight, Hotel, Rental Car, Train).

As you can see in Figure 11, another advantage of the new experience is that you get budget transparency at the trip level. Also, you have flexibility to book parts of the travel now and other parts later.

Technically it supports deep linking, which means that you can send a trip-level link to colleagues which includes all the trip parts, making it easy to coordinate trip planning when travelling with others.

To find out more, have a look at the

  • Documentation: Trip Planning in New Concur Travel.

Booking Agent in Concur Travel

The new Booking Agent lets you use natural language to book business travel which is compliant with company policy and budget constraints as well as taking into account your personal travel preferences.

Figure 12 shows an example where the user has simply stated “I want to book a flight from San Francisco to London on Sept 9th and back on Sept 13th”. The answer shown takes into account the user’s frequent traveler memberships, flight availability and company policies.

Figure 12: New Concur Travel Booking Agent in Joule. Alt Text: A screenshot of Concur Travel with Joule opened on the right, the content is explained in the main text, with the possible flights listed alongside a thumbnail image representing the airline “jetBlue”.

Watch it in action and find out more:

  • Video: Concur Travel – Booking Agent demo (2:33 min.)
  • SAP Discovery Center: Booking Agent.

 

Continue Reading - UX Innovations in UI Design and Technology for Web and Mobile

I hope you enjoyed this sixth part, covering SAP Customer Experience and SAP Concur, with great new AI-powered user experiences helping users work more efficiently and effectively.

Here is the link to the final part seven, covering latest innovations in UI design and technology for web and mobile:

  • SAP UX Q3/2025 Update – Part 7: UI Design and Technology for Web and Mobile.

Part 1 of the series lists all the parts, and links to those parts that have already been published:

  • SAP UX Q3/2025 Update – Part 1: AI, Joule, SAP Build Work Zone, SAP Mobile Start.

Do keep posting your experiences and recommendations yourself in the SAP Community, with the SAP Fiori and/or the User Experience tag! In case you are wondering how to get a list of the most recent blog posts on SAP Fiori and User Experience in our new SAP Community, use these links:

  • Latest blog posts on SAP Fiori in the SAP Community.
  • Latest blog posts on User Experience in the SAP Community.

entry.title: No More Guesswork: Joule’s Help Content Makes SAP Fieldglass Easy to Use

Joule for SAP Fieldglass is a productivity accelerator embedded directly into your SAP Fieldglass experience. Joule uses natural language processing to help users complete tasks, retrieve documentation, and make decisions faster—all without leaving the application.

Whether you're creating job postings or navigating other tasks, Joule delivers smart, contextual guidance. It’s like having a support expert built right in.

Use Case: “I’m going out on vacation—how do I assign a proxy?”

This is a common need in SAP Fieldglass ensuring continuity for tasks while away.  Instead of digging through manuals users can ask Joule:

“I’m going out on vacation—how do I assign a proxy?”

Joule delivers the relevant help documentation from the SAP Help Portal, complete with step-by-step instructions. This access to help content empowers users to self-serve confidently—boosting adoption and user experience.

With Joule, SAP Fieldglass becomes intuitive, responsive, and user-friendly.

entry.title: End to End Activation Guide for S/4HANA public Cloud and SAP Business AI - Joule
entry.content:
SAP Business AI - Joule in S/4HANA public Cloud

    End-to-End activation guide for SAP S/4 HANA and SAP AI-Copilot

 

  1. Introduction:

SAP Business AI is SAP’s integrated approach to bringing artificial intelligence directly into business processes, applications, and user experiences.

Its core strength is contextual intelligence—leveraging master and transactional data while respecting each user’s role and authorizations.

There are two Main pillars in SAP AI Strategy.

  • Custom AI Solutions via SAP BTP AI Services – e.g., SAP AI Core, Launchpad services.
  • Business AI – native AI capabilities embedded across SAP’s applications.

 

 

  1. In a previous blog, I covered building custom AI in BTP . “#Vectorize your data for Infuse AI in to Business using Hana Vector and Generative AI”.
  2. This post focuses on the second pillar—Starting from a clean SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition tenant activation and enabling Business AI - Joule (AI copilot) setup.

2 On-Boarding process of SAP S/4HANA Cloud, public edition for TDD:

This section covers entitlement ordering, system provisioning, tenant activation, identity services setup, and post-onboarding configurations for the Test, Demo & Development (TDD) edition.

2.1 Order the CBC, IAS/IPS & S4 Tenants :

Log in to SAP Partner Portal with your S-user. [ https://partneredge.sap.com/].

Request TDD license; admin receives welcome emails with CBC, IAS/IPS & S/4 tenant URLs and admin credentials.

2.2 Provisioning  the Technical System:

System provisioning can be done  via 'SAP for Me’.

The sequence of system provisioning should be CBC , CIS Sync up[IAS/IPS], SAP S/4 HANA Dev and Customizing Tenant.

2.3 CBC Set up:

  1. Configure Scope and Organisational Structure in CBC.
  2. Create an Evaluation Project (not Implementation).
  3. Assign required CBC roles.
  4. Select demo data during initial project setup.
  5. Ensure deployment targets point to your S/4HANA Public Cloud URL.

 

           

2.4 Additional CBC Set UP and guidelines:

  • Find CBC URL: CIS → Applications → XSUAA → CBC → Home URL.
  • Replicate CBC groups to CIS via IPS resync job.
  • Assign correct CBC roles in IAS and maintain correct user IDs to avoid login issues.
  • Validate target system properties in CBC admin console.

 

2.5 User Setup in CIS & S/4:

Once all the set ups are done , you can see the below FLP looks like this.

You can use the identity access MGMT tile to onboard the new users , roles and groups.

By default, the Super Admin is assigned the SAP_BR_Administrator role along with other standard SAP roles in the SAP S/4HANA Cloud application.

The best practice is to Create the custom roles from the template and assign to the user instead of assign the standard role.

To onboard a new user you can follow the below steps in CIS and SAP S/4 HANA Cloud.

3. Enabling Business AI Copilot (Joule) in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud

This purpose of this guide is to provide step-by-step instructions on how to set up a Joule that can work in SAP SAP S/4 HANA public Cloud Edition.

3.1 Validate the Joule service assignment.

 In BTP Entitlements, ensure Joule is assigned.

Add missing service plans and Save

        

 

3.2 Validate SAP BTP Build Work Zone- Standard Edition.

  • Add Work Zone in entitlements if missing.
  • Ensure Joule and Work Zone are in the same global account, subaccount, and region where Joule is available.
  •  you need to carefully choose the right data center where Joule is available and nearest to your location.

       

3.3 Validate the System Registration in BTP : [Auto-Discovered / Manual]

In the SAP BTP cockpit, you can have the overview of all your systems associated with your customer ID. These systems can be registered or auto discovered.

Make sure that your SAP S/4 HANA DEV and Customizing Tenants ,  CIS Tenant  and CBC Tenants which you are configured earlier are exists here . If not you need to add it manually in the BTP Global Account à System Landscape Systems link.

 

3.4 Get the token for your system from BTP and Register it in S/4HANA Cloud Tenant

Choose your SAP S/4 HANA public cloud Tenant in the system Landscape-->Systems--> Choose All Communication Scenarios --> Get Token

Capture the registration token and keep  and login in to SAP S/4 HANA cloud .

Register this token in Maintain extension link and Click on Approve  button as YES.

 

Once this is completed , Refresh the system landscape button , and you can see your SAP S/4 HANA cloud system status shown as registered in green color.

3.5 Set up the subaccount , Spaces and Cloud Foundry.

As part of your sub account creation , make sure that you are going to choose the right region where joule data centers are available.

Once sub account has been created , create the Cloud Foundry and Space.

3.6 Set up the Entitlement in the subaccount.

Go to your subaccount à Entitlements--> Add service Plan -->Search Joule and work zone and add those services.

  • Setup Trust Configuration

From the Navigation Pane on the left, select Trust Configuration. Click Establish Trust.

From the CIS  tenants, choose the one that is also used by your applications and click Next.
Note: The tenant chosen here must be the same as the one used by SAP S/4 HANA Cloud application for which Joule is configured.

3.7 Trust the Domain in BTP.

Need to  add the Trusted Domains. To do this, click on the Settings options in the Subaccount and click on Add under Trusted Domain.

   

3.8 Trust the Domain in SAP Cloud Identity Services

Click on CISà Applications and Resources -> select Tenant Settings -> and then click on Customization -> click on the Trusted Domains option -> add your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition URLs

3.9 Create the service key for SAP Build Work Zone, standard edition.

This  Service Key which will be used during the destination creations and for SAP CIS – Identity Provisioning Services (source & target) role mapping to your Work Zone.

 

Assign the required roles as well for the users.

3.10 Run the Joule Booster in the BTP Global account

BTP Global Account--> click Boosters >> search for Joule >> click Start on Setting up Joule tile.

 

 

Finally you will get the success message like this.

3.11 Post Booster Validation.

The formation created here is a logical grouping of SAP systems. Once the formation is created, you can include an SAP solution system in it and change it anytime.

 

 

3.12 Create Navigation Service Destination

We need the destination services for Joule to work with your LoB applications in SAP S/4HANA Cloud. To create this, SAP BTP Subaccount, --> Connectivity option --> Destination --> Create New Destination.

 

You have to use the Service Key for the Joule.

This contains client id , secret  Token URL..etc.

3.13 SAP S/4HANA Destinations setup in BTP Subaccount 

Navigate in to BTP Sub Account  --> Click Connectivity -> Destinations and confirm the destinations required for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition are successfully created in your BTP Subaccount. The following 5 destinations should already exist in your BTP S4HANA_PUB_SSO

  • SAP S/4HANA SSO
  • Joule Design time Destination
  • Joule Run time Destination
  • Runtime Default
  • Runtime Datas

Already you have created the “navigation service” manually.

3.14 Validate the Communication Arrangements:

Navigate in to  SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition System -->  launch the Communication Arrangements Tile.

Confirm that Communication Arrangements with Scenario ID SAP_COM_0647 and SAP_COM_0882 are automatically added by the Joule booster.

 

 Make sure SAP_COM_0647 exposure role collection is set to ALL.

 

The navigate in to Communication Systems Tile.

You can 4 new systems are created. The System ID and System Names will have cryptic values.

3.15 Create the Inbound Communication System:

Navigate to Communication system à Create the new one-->Specify the host name and port and create the communication user Id and proposed  password.

For the communication arrangement choose SAP_COM_0193  and save it.

3.16 Create Communication Use for the communication System step

Create the  Communication User . Navigate to --> Maintain Communication Users -> Click on New and enter the details 

Capture this user id and password will be used in Source system creation step.            

3.17 Manage Content Security Policy

Navigate to SAP S/4 HANA Cloud--> Manage Content Security Policy à Trusted Sites--> Managed By--> UI_RESOURCES_SCRIPTS --> Managed by Customer tab--> Add the URL of the Joule.

This Joule URL you can get it from the BTP cockpit – Joule Service.           

3.18 Configure the IDP for SSO set up between Source and the Target System.

Here the

  • Source system is SAP S/4HANA Public cloud
  • Target system is SAP BTP Build zone standard edition.

You have option to create the system manually or upload the template of Source and Target System.

Find the attachment of the ZIP file.  From this template you can easily create the source and target files.

 

Go to CIS console -->  IDP --> Source System --> Click Add --.> Browse and Upload the Source File.

Update the properties as per screen shot.

Here you need to update the User and Password captured from the STEP 15 [Communication user creation step in S/4 HANA]

 

Target System Creation:

Upload Target JSON file by click on ADD button in the IDP-->Target system.

Proceed the update the details and properties.

Source System -  Earlier you created.

cflp.providerId :   ID of the S/4 content provider created in Work Zone.

URL : portal-service url from the from the  Work Zone instance in BTP.

OAuth2TokenServiceURL :  URL from the Work Zone instance in BTP should be ends woth oauth/token.

User: clientid 

Password: clientsecret 

3.19 Provision Users and Groups from S/4HANA Cloud to Work Zone

Navigate in to Identity Provisioning >> Source Systems--> Choose the system you created --> Job--> Read Job--> Click Run Now button.

In the provisioning Logs , verify the log status.

You can find the status of the user and groups  in Work Zone channel manager by click on refresh button.

3.20 Verify Joule in SAP Fiori Launch Pad / Work Zone.

Enter the URL of the SAP S/4 HANA Public Cloud in the browser --> You can notice the DIAMOND icon of  JOULE in the TOP right corner.

Open and enter your queries in the interactive assistant.

4 Conclusion:

In this blog post , I have covered the end-to-end steps for set up the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition tenant in TDD environment and activate the Business AI- Joule.

Following that I provided the detailed steps like Onboarding , Provisioning the system, CBC set up, CIS IAS /IPS set ups , BTP service activation ,  Boosters for the service , System and user set up , Trust and SSO set ups.

entry.title: SAP UX Q3/2025 Update – Part 7: UI Design and Technology for Web and Mobile
entry.content:
This seventh and last post in my series gives an overview innovations in our UI tools and technologies, making it ever easier to design, build and integrate UIs, for both web and mobile applications. For designing apps, web and mobile, we have a new SAP Design System portal and UI Kits in Figma. For developers, we have added further AI assistance, as well as many individual improvements, including support for the latest international accessibility standard WCAG 2.2. Fun fact: SAPUI5 is now used on all 7 continents – yes, Antarctica too! 

Before reading this, do read the first blog post introducing the series and providing general information about Joule and central entry points and services, along with links to all the published parts of this blog post series:

  • SAP UX Q3/2025 Update – Part 1: AI, Joule, SAP Build Work Zone, SAP Mobile Start.

The above post also gives an update on building your own Joule agents, so I will not cover that here, but rather focus on web and mobile UI development.

 

Design News

SAP Design System Portal and UI Kits in Figma

We recently introduced the new SAP Design System portal that brings together the product design guidelines SAP Fiori for web, SAP Fiori for iOS, and SAP Fiori for Android, as well as to the new digital design system guidelines. With its enhanced usability, simplified versioning and improved performance, designers (and developers!) get a better user experience compared with the previous SAP Fiori design guidelines.

Figure 1: The SAP Design System portal start page. Alt Text: Image with header saying “SAP Design System”, with a “See what’s new” button below it, and then four subsections in a horizontal row: SAP Fiori for Web, SAP Fiori for Android, SAP Fiori for iOS and SAP’s Digitial Design System. A “Feedback” button is on the bottom right.

The new UI Kits available for designers in Figma make it easy for designers to design accessible UIs at enterprise scale, for web applications, mobile iOS and Android applications as well as wearables. The UI Kits provide reusable components for web and mobile, along with web floorplans, which give you what you need out-of-the-box.

Figure 2: SAP’s UI Kits for Designers in Figma. Alt-Text: The image shows two rows of four cards representing UI Kits: SAP Fiori for Android, SAP Fiori for Web, Designing for Performance, SAP Fiori for iOS, SAP Fiori for watchOS, SAP Fiori for Wear OS, SAP S/4HANA for Web, and Accessibility Design Tools. On the very left of the image information about SAP is listed, with links to resources such as www.sap.com/design-system.

Find out more here:

  • New SAP Design System Portal for SAP Fiori Design Guidelines, and New UI Kits for Designers.

Design Updates for the SAP Business Suite

Consistency of the user experience across the various applications used by a user is an important part of overall usability, helping users to feel confident and at ease when using a suite of products – no unexpected surprises. We have identified areas directly relevant to users and plan to introduce a number of design updates in SAP Fiori for web across our suite of products to further increase consistency.

The areas we have redesigned and which we plan to provide across our suite of products this year and next year are:

  • Shell bar (at the top of the user’s screen)
  • Navigation menu: side navigation (see Figure 3 below).
  • User menu
  • Notifications
  • Search in the shell bar

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition already supports the first four of these, you can have a look at them in part 2 of this series, in the section SAP Fiori Launchpad and Design Updates for Suite Consistency:

  • SAP UX Q3/2025 Update – Part 2: SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 and SAP Fiori Launchpad.

As outlined in Part 1, SAP Build Work Zone standard edition also supports side navigation.

Find out more about these design updates here:

  • Upcoming Design Updates for the SAP Business Suite (SAP Fiori for Web).

We also provide designers with a refreshed new set of illustrations, to be used for illustrated messages. Figure 3 shows some examples.

Figure 3: Examples of new illustrations. Alt Text: On the left top three different size illustrations showing an ice cream cone fallen on the ground; bottom left an illustration of a globe with a magnifying glass, representing “search”. On the right an image of a list report showing the search illustration since no data has been selected.

 

News for Creating Web UIs

Extensibility made easy with the SAP Build Extensibility Wizard

Extending SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition is made much easier since we introduced the SAP Build Extensibility Wizard. The latest update introduces the ability to create an SAPUI5 adaptation project as a User Interface Extension.

Figure 4: Creating an SAPUI5 adaptation project as a User Interface Extension. Alt Text: Screenshot showing step 1 “Extension” task where users can select from a row of four cards “Custom Field”, “Custom Logic”, “Custom Process” and “User Interface Extension”. The latter has a subtext “Adapt the current application or extend it visually with a new application”. The latter two cards have a link “Manage SAP Build Projects” at the bottom. The bottom right shows two buttons “Next” and “Cancel”.

Learn more here:

  • SAP Build Extensibility Wizard for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.
  • Simplify SAPUI5 Code Extensions with the SAP Build Extensibility Wizard

AI-assisted auto-fix of coding errors with UI5 linter

UI5 linter is the tool of choice to check your UI5 project for using best practices and replacement of deprecated SAPUI5 APIs. With UI5 linter v1.12.0, we are happy to announce the initial version of an autofix feature: Use the "--fix" argument to let UI5 linter apply fixes to your code automatically. Read more about it here:

  • Migrate your code with UI5 linter – Autofix has landed.

Legacy-free version of SAPUI5 available via cloud access

Once you have removed code which uses deprecated SAPUI5 APIs, you can try out the legacy-free version of SAP UI5 in the cloud, which has all deprecated code removed. Discover the benefits and how to try it out in this blog post:

  • Explore SAPUI5/OpenUI5 1.136.x-legacy-free.

Accessibility taken to the next level: WCAG 2.2 support

Accessibility is key to using SAP's business solutions. Adopting the latest standards gives applications a true cutting edge, ensuring that solutions are inclusive and meet the diverse needs of users globally. When creating apps with SAP Build and SAPUI5, developers can leverage the latest Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.2.

For example, two of the key new requirements in the 2.2 version are:

  • The minimum target size of an interactive element now needs to be 24x24 px, so that users don’t accidentally activate a neighbouring element.
  • Each operation that can be performed by dragging can also be performed alternatively without dragging – so that people who cannot use a mouse to drag can still use the UI.

See more details:

  • SAPUI5 is Leading the Way in Accessibility with WCAG 2.2

SAP Fiori tools – open source, faster app creation, more AI

One of the most powerful recent innovations is the AI-powered project accelerator from SAP Fiori tools, which allows you to create a fully functional app with database tables, CDS-Views, OData service and a Fiori element list report UI based on a sketch of what you want. I introduced this in my Q1 update post from March. This can now be started from Joule in SAP Build Code. Also, it has been further enhanced, and is also available as open source, so that our developer community can make contributions themselves. Find out more here:

  • From idea to app: using AI-powered Project Accelerator to develop SAP Fiori apps
  • SAP Fiori Application Generator Available in Open Source

For those of you developing in ABAP, we have introduced the new quick SAP Fiori application generator to create and deploy simple SAP Fiori applications from ABAP Development Tools for Eclipse. Have a closer look:

  • Quickly Generate and Deploy SAP Fiori Apps from ABAP Development Tools for Eclipse

To get an overview of these plus some additional enhancements, have a look at:

  • SAP Fiori tools 2506 update – Open source, faster app creation, adaptation boost, AI enhancements.

Enhancements for SAP Fiori Elements with OData V4

We are continuously enhancing SAPUI5 and SAP Fiori elements. I have picked two enhancements to highlight here for developers using SAPUI5 and SAP Fiori elements on OData V4, which are covered in the following subsections:

  • Support for inline edit for object pages.
  • Support for the analytical table on the object page.

Support for inline edit for object pages

You can now develop object pages where users can directly edit fields within facets, without having to first press the “Edit” button and go into edit mode. Figure 5 shows an example from a test application.

Figure 5: Inline editing of fields in an object page with SAP Fiori elements for OData V4. Alt Text: A screenshot of part of an object page “Travel”, which is overall in display mode, but the field “Starting Date” has been selected and is editable, with a new entry made, and “Save” and “Cancel” icons next to the field.

Support for the analytical table on the object page

For applications where users need to be able to analyze the data in a table, for example grouping data and aggregating data, developers should use the analytical table rather than the responsive table.

These tables are often used for the “list” part of an SAP Fiori elements list report, which consists of a list and an object page for the details. Now, developers using SAPUI5 and SAP Fiori elements on OData V4 can include an analytical table into one of the facets of an object page. Figure 6 shows an example.

Figure 6: Analytical table in an object page with SAP Fiori elements for OData V4. Alt Text: A screenshot of an object page with a facet “Journal Entries (4)” which contains an analytical table, where the entries are grouped by “Case Journal Entry”. One of the groups is expanded, showing two lines. Below them the sum of the debit column is shown for the expanded group, and below that for the entire table.

Further Updates for SAPUI5

As I described in part 1 of this series, we have introduced a new option to preview an upcoming SAPUI5 version for SAP Build Work Zone. This capability aims to provide a controlled environment for evaluating SAPUI5 updates in SAP Build Work Zone, thereby avoiding immediate changes in production environments:

  • Introducing SAPUI5 Version Preview in SAP Build Work Zone.

Key users can create consistent text changes with SAPUI5 flexibility. I described this in the context of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition in part 2 of this series (section Key Users Can Rearrange ID and Description Within a Field or Column). They can also easily change the labels used, to fit terms established within the company. Read more about this here:

  • How Key Users Create Consistent Text Changes with SAPUI5 Flexibility.

SAPUI5 has reached a new milestone: it is now used on all 7 continents. Yes, we have reached Antarctica!

  • SAPUI5 adoption becoming more universal.

In case you have not updated your system for a while, then be aware that we are removing SAP Fiori themes Belize and Blue Crystal. Also, make sure that you are using the latest browser versions, which may mean ensuring that your users laptops and desktops are using newer operating system versions:

  • Upcoming Removal of SAP Fiori Themes Belize and Blue Crystal
  • Prevent an SAP Fiori / SAPUI5 Downtime — Check Your Browser Strategy Today!

To get a complete overview of all the enhancements in SAPUI5 including SAP Fiori elements, look at the UI5 demo kit. You’ll find some of the enhancements mentioned above listed under version 1.136.

  • What’s New in SAP UI5.

 

News for Mobile Designers and Developers

The main news for mobile designers are the new SAP Design System portal, which covers Android and iOS as well as the latest releases of the mobile Figma design kits for Android, iOS, WatchOs and WearOS.

Figure 7: The Android and iOS pages in the new SAP Design System portal. Alt Text: Both screenshots look the same, except for Android vs iOS text. The top has a “Get Started” section, with a row of cards to navigate to UI Elements, UI Kit, Development Documentation. Below that a “What’s New” section, with information about the latest release “SAP Fiori for Android version 25.8” and “…for iOS…”.

The best place to stay up-to-date with these latest enhancements is the respective What’s New section in the SAP Design System portal:

  • SAP BTP SDK for iOS 25.4: What’s new for SAP Fiori for iOS
  • SAP BTP SDK for Android 25.8 (design preview) and 25.4: What’s new for SAP Fiori for Android

Figure 8 shows two of the many new enhancements: the new illustrations mentioned earlier in the section on web UIs are also available for mobile, both for iOS and Android. The other example shown there is the updated date picker for Android, which now allows users to select date ranges.

Figure 8: On the left, an example of the new illustrated messages for mobile. On the right, date ranges can now be selected in the date picker for Android. Alt Text: The illustrated message is used in a pop-over. The illustration shows a sheet of paper with a tickmark, below that the text “You’re all caught up…” and two buttons “Add Task” and “Remind Me Later”. On the right two date screens are shown for the month of April: the left one has the 8th marked, the right one has the range from 8th to 16th marked.

Developers get new features with the latest releases of the mobile SDKs, as well as the the Mobile Development Kit (MDK) which is integrated into SAP Build Code. Here are links to find out more about them:

  • What’s new in Mobile development kit client 25.6, for example:
    • Support grouping in Object Table Control
    • Donut chart support
    • … and more.
  • Continuous Innovation in Mobile Design & Technology: SAP Fiori for Android and iOS 25.4
  • SAP BTP SDK for iOS: What’s New in 25.08
  • SAP BTP SDK for Android 25.4.0 is now available

 

Final words

As you can see from all seven posts in the series, we continue to progress rapidly with the user experience of our product portfolio, especially with regards to AI-assistance.

Part 1 of the series lists all the parts, and links to those parts that have already been published:

  • SAP UX Q3/2025 Update – Part 1: AI, Joule, SAP Build Work Zone, SAP Mobile Start.

Do keep posting your experiences and recommendations yourself in the SAP Community, with the SAP Fiori and/or the User Experience tag! In case you are wondering how to get a list of the most recent blog posts on SAP Fiori and User Experience in our new SAP Community, use these links:

  • Latest blog posts on SAP Fiori in the SAP Community.
  • Latest blog posts on User Experience in the SAP Community.

For general information on design at SAP and SAP Fiori, check out:

  • www.sap.com/design.
  • www.sap.com/fiori.
  • SAP Community: SAP Fiori topic page.

entry.title: SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition をデータリポジトリにした Document Grounding の設定手順
entry.content:
はじめに 

SAP の生成AIアシスタント Joule には、Document Grounding の機能が提供されています。これにより、社内の業務ドキュメントの内容を元に迅速で的確な回答を生成できるようになります。例えば、従業員が社内ポリシーやマニュアルについて質問した際、Jouleは大規模言語モデルの知識だけでなく、会社内に保存された関連ドキュメントの内容を参照して回答します。従来この Document Grounding 機能は Microsoft SharePoint をデータソースとしてサポートしていましたが、SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition 上のコンテンツも参照可能になりました。SAP Build Work Zone 上のワークスペースのパブリックコンテンツ（全ユーザーに公開されたドキュメントやページ）をJouleの提供する回答のソース情報として利用できるようになるため、社内ナレッジをより活用した回答が期待できます。 

本記事では、SAP Build Work Zone をドキュメントリポジトリとして設定し、Jouleのドキュメントグラウンディングを有効化する手順を解説します。これにより SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition 内に格納したPDFやWordファイル、ナレッジベース記事などをインデックス化し、ユーザーの質問に対してそれらのファイルの内容に基づく回答を Joule が生成できるようになります。なお、本記事の読者は SAP BTP や SAP Build Work Zone の基本的な知識を有していることを前提とします。 

前提条件 

本手順を開始する前に、以下の準備が整っていることを確認してください。 

  • SAP BTP 環境と Joule のセットアップ: SAP BTP のグローバルアカウントおよびサブアカウントがあり、Joule のサブスクリプションが有効になっていること。 
  • SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition: SAP Build Work Zone, advanced editionが利用可能で、サイトが初期セットアップ済みであること。 
  • アイデンティティと認証基盤: SAP Cloud Identity Services (Identity Authentication) でシングルサインオン基盤が整備され、Jouleと統合製品（SAP Build Work Zone）間でグローバルユーザーID（user UUID）が共有されていること。Joule導入時にIdentity Authenticationの信頼関係を設定済みであること。 
  • SAP Build Work Zone 管理者権限: SAP Build Work Zone の管理コンソールにアクセスでき、機能の有効化や設定変更を行える管理者ユーザーとしてログインできる。 

以上の前提を満たした上で、以下に示す手順に従って設定を行います。 

全体構成図 

公式なSAP Help Portalのセットアップガイドから、全体の俯瞰図を描いてみると以下のような形になると考えられます。
なお、こちらは個人的な見解であり、情報の正当性には細心の注意を払ってください。 

【随時、更新します】 

手順 

今回は下記のSAP Help Portalの手順に則った上でセットアップを進めていきます。 

GitHub上に手順をまとめたスクリプトを用意していますので、ぜひご活用ください。ただし、正確な手順はSAP Help Portalに準じます。 

まずは下記の通り、GitHub上のリポジトリをクローンしましょう。 

git clone https://github.com/watwatwhat/document-grounding-setup.git

下記コマンドを実行して、セットアップガイドスクリプトを起動しましょう。 

./main.sh

 このガイドは、インタラクティブに手順を実行することができるように設計されています。1~12までを順次選択しながら進んで行きましょう。 

 1. Document Grounding サービスの有効化 

まず、SAP BTP上で Document Grounding のサービスインスタンスを作成します。このサービスがJouleで社内ドキュメントを取り扱うための技術的な基盤となります。 

  1. まずはセットアップガイドスクリプトを起動し、メニューから 「1. Create Document Grounding Instance」 を選択します。
  2. Document Groundingのインスタンスの名前やそこに追加するサービスインスタンスの名前を決めて入力しましょう。今回の例では、それぞれ「document-grounding-other」「sb-document-grounding-other」としています。この入力値に基づいてセットアップの指示が表示されるので、その通りに設定を行いましょう。 
    （該当する公式ドキュメント：SAP Help Portal: Configure User Authentication） 
  3. BTP Cockpitでサービスの作成: JouleをサブスクライブしているサブアカウントのBTP Cockpitにログインし、「Service Marketplace」を開きます。 サービス一覧から「Document Grounding」を検索し、該当のサービスを選択します。 サービスインスタンスの作成: 「作成(Create)」ボタンをクリックします。プランはデフォルト（通常は data-manager プラン）を選択します。 
  4. Instance Nameには、 先ほど設定したインスタンス名を入力します。（例: document-docgrounding-other）Runtime Environment（実行環境）は 「Other」 を選択してください。Plan（サービスプラン）は「data-manager」 を選択してください。入力後、「Create（作成）」を実行しインスタンスを作成します。 
  5. インスタンス作成後、一覧に表示された当該インスタンスを選択し、Service Bindingの作成を行います。「Create（作成）」ボタンをクリックします。サービスバインディングの名前も先ほど決めたものを入力しましょう。（例：sb-document-grounding-other） 
  6. 作成後、サービスバインディングの名前をクリックし、サービスバインディングのURL をコピーしてください。 
  7. これを先ほどの待機しているセットアップガイドスクリプトに標準入力します。このように入力された必要情報はローカルの設定ファイルに保存されるようになっています。 

2. Cloud Identity Services インスタンスの有効化 

次に、Document Grounding サービスへセキュアにアクセスするための SAP Cloud Identity Services のインスタンスの有効化設定をします。ここでは SAP Cloud Identity Services上にJoule用のXSUAAインスタンスを作成し、クライアント証明書を発行してDocument Groundingサービスへのアクセスに利用します。 

  1. セットアップガイドスクリプトを起動し、「2. Create Cloud Identity Services Instance」 を選択します。 
  2. インスタンスの名前とサービスバインディングの名前を決め、出力された手順に従ってBTP Cockpitからインスタンスを有効化します。今回はそれぞれ 「cis-other」 と 「sb-cis-other」 という名前にしています。 

  3.  

    BTP Cockpit の Service Marketplace に戻り、「Cloud Identity Services」を検索して選択します。「create(作成)」 をクリックし、プランは 「application」、Runtime Environmentは 「Other」 を選択します。インスタンス名を先ほど決めた名前を入力します。（例: cis-other）入力が終わったら、「Next（次へ）」 をクリックしましょう。 

  4.  「パラメーター」 設定画面が表示されたら、以下のJSONを入力します。これによって、Document Grounding サービスとの紐付けが行われます。 

{ 
 "consumed-services": [ 
   { 
     "service-instance-name": "<Document Grounding インスタンス名>" 
   } 
 ] 
}
  • インスタンスが作成されたら、Service Bindings 部分にある 「Create（作成）」 ボタンより、サービスバインディングを作成します。 
  • 作成したCloud Identity Servicesインスタンスを選択し、「サービスキーを作成(Create Service Key)」します。サービスキー名先ほど決定したものを入力します。（例：sb-cis-other）サービスキー作成時に以下のパラメーターを指定します。これにより、このXSUAAインスタンスに紐づくOAuthクライアントのX.509証明書と秘密鍵が生成されます（有効期限365日)。
{ 
 "credential-type": "X509_GENERATED", 
 "validity": 365, 
 "validity-type": "DAYS" 
}

 

  • サービスバインディングが作成できたら、名前をクリックしてバインディングの内容を確認します。このうち、「clientid」 と 「authorization_endpoint」 の値をコピーします。 
  • セットアップガイドスクリプトに値を渡します。後ほどこの値を使ってCloud Identity Servicesからトークンを取得しますが、 その時に利用する値が設定ファイルに書き込まれて保存されました。 

 

 3. 証明書の作成 

上記Cloud Identity Servicesのサービスバインディングにより、認証に利用する証明書が発行されました。しかしこちらは改行文字の変換等の処理が必要です。このステップでは、その変換処理を行います。 

  1. セットアップガイドスクリプトを起動し、「3. Create Certificate Files」 を実行します。これにより、credentials フォルダの配下に 「cis_certificate.cer」 と 「cis_key.key」 が作成されます。このファイルの内容を、それぞれCloud Identity Services のサービスバインディングに記載されている 「certificate」 「key」 の内容に書き換えてください。 

  2.  

    それぞれ記入が終わったら、「y」を入力して次に進みましょう。 

  3.  

    次に変換処理後の証明書と秘密鍵ファイルの名前をどうするかを尋ねられますが、特に理由がなければそのままEnterでデフォルトの無難な名前が設定されるようにしています。この変換後のファイルは「credentials_adjusted」 フォルダの配下に格納されるようになっています。 

     

4. Document Grounding APIへの接続をテスト 

これでDocument Groundingサービスへの操作を行う準備が整いました。まずは設定済みのドキュメント取り込みパイプラインを一覧表示するAPIを呼び出してみましょう。 

  1. セットアップガイドスクリプトを起動し、「4. Get Access Token 」 を呼び出します。内部では、上記で用意した証明書ファイルと秘密鍵ファイルを用いて、Document Groundingサービス用のOAuthトークンを取得しています。下記のようなリクエストを送信しています。取得されたトークンは設定ファイルに保存されます。 
curl --request POST \ 
    --url https://<authorization_endpointのドメイン>/oauth2/token \ 
    --header "accept: application/json" \ 
    --header "content-type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded" \ 
    --data "client_id=<上でメモしたclientid>" \ 
    --data "grant_type=client_credentials" \ 
    --cert ./doc-grounding.crt \ 
    --key  ./doc-grounding.key
  • 続いてセットアップガイドスクリプトを起動し、「5. Test Document Grounding Endpoint 」 を実行しましょう。これにより現在設定されているパイプラインの一覧が取得できます。初回実行であれば何もパイプラインは存在しないはずなので、 [] という空配列が返ってきます。 

 

5. SAP Build Work Zone 側の外部統合に関する設定 

続いて、SAP Build Work Zone 側で Document Grounding との連携を行うための設定を行います。（該当する公式ドキュメント：SAP Help Portal: Integration With Document Grounding） 

  1. SAP Build Work Zone Advanced Editionの管理者として Admin Console にログインし、「Feature Enablement（機能の有効化）」 を開きます。 

  2.  

    まず、SAP Work Zone側で外部連携する際に使用するOAuthクライアントを作成します。「External Integration」 -> 「OAuth Clients」 に移動し、「Add OAuth Client」 より新規OAuthクライアントを作成します。 

  3.  

    適当な名前とIntegration URLを記入し、「Save」ボタンで保存します。今回は「Document Grounding OAuth Client」という名前および、本環境のJouleのURLをIntegration URLに入力しました。 

  4.

最後に、Document Groundingサービスに対して SAP Build Work Zone コンテンツを取り込み登録（インデックス化）する処理を設定します。これはパイプラインと呼ばれるスケジュールされたデータ取り込みジョブの登録で、設定後は定期的（1日1回）にWork Zone上のドキュメントをクロールし、最新内容がJouleに取り込まれます。

curl --request POST \

    }' \

    無事処理が完了するとパイプラインIDが返されます。このIDにより、Document Groundingサービス上で SAP Build Work Zone コンテンツを取得するパイプラインジョブが管理されます。パイプラインの作成と同時に初回実行が行われ、SAP Build Work Zone内のパブリックコンテンツ（アップロードされたドキュメント等）が読み込まれ、ベクトルインデックスが作成されます。以降は1日1回の頻度でWork Zone側の更新を自動反映します。手動で最新化したい場合はパイプラインAPIで適宜再実行することも可能です。（後述） 

 

グラウンディングの準備とパイプラインの手動実行 

これでDocument Groundingの機能を利用して、Jouleに回答を生成させる準備が完了しました。最後に、実際にドキュメントを読み込ませた上で回答させてみましょう。 

  1. 今回はITセキュリティポリシーに関するサンプル文書を用意しました。こちらをSAP Build Work Zoneにアップロードしましょう。なお、現時点（2025/08/29）では、英語の文書に対してのみ、グラウンディングは動作するようです。 

  2.  

    SAP Build Work Zoneのコンテンツページより、アップロードを行います。 

  3.  

    また、このワークスペースの単位でも Document Grounding を有効化する必要があります。「Workspace Admin Settings」より設定に進みましょう。 

  4.  

    Document Grounding の部分のチェックボックスを有効化して、「Save」より設定を保存します。 

  5.  

    最後に、セットアップガイドスクリプトから「10. Trigger Pipeline」を実行して、パイプラインを手動実行します。 

  6.  

    パイプラインの実行状態は、セットアップガイドスクリプトの「8. Check Grounding Status」より確認できます。うまくGroundingの取り込みが完了していると、「INDEXED」という表記が確認できます。 

     

     

Document Grounding の実行 

最後に、Document GroundingをJouleから実行し、SAP Build Work Zone, Advanced Edition上のコンテンツファイルの記述内容に基づいた回答が返ってくることを確認しましょう。 

  1. まずは上記の Document Grounding の設定を行う前の回答を見てみましょう。一般的な回答が返ってきており、詳細は管理者に問い合わせるように案内されます。 

  2.  

    そして、下記が設定を行った後の回答です。しっかりと社内文書に基づいて回答が生成されていることが確認できます。ちなみに、Sourcesからドキュメント名をクリックすると、SAP Build Work Zone内の対象文書のページに遷移することができます。 

     


まとめ 

以上の手順により、SAP Build Work Zone, Advanced Edition に保存された社内ドキュメントをデータソースとして、Joule のドキュメントグラウンディング機能を設定できました。これにより、ユーザーがJouleに対して行う質問に対し、Work Zone内のファイル（PDFやWord文書など）の内容を根拠にした回答が生成されるようになります。たとえば社内規程集のPDFをWork Zoneにアップロードしパブリックに公開しておけば、Jouleに規程の詳細を尋ねた際にそのPDFから回答が引用されるようになります。 

社内ナレッジを有効活用することで、Jouleの回答精度向上や信頼性の高い情報提供が期待できます。ただし前述の通り、現在この機能ではドキュメントがテナント内の全ユーザーにとって参照可能な情報源となる点に留意し、公開して問題ない情報のみをアップロードしてください。機能拡張により将来的にはユーザー権限に応じた応答制御なども行われる可能性があります。 

最後に、設定に際して不明点があればSAPヘルプの公式ドキュメント（Integrating Joule with SAP Solutions内の 「Set Up Document Grounding」 節や、SAP Build Work Zone, advanced editionの「Integration With Document Grounding」ガイド）を参照してください。最新情報や制約事項が更新されている場合があります。本記事の手順を参考に、自社環境でJouleとWork Zoneを連携させ、社内文書に基づく高度なQ&Aシステムを活用してみてください。

entry.title: Joule for Consultants: How small can you start?
entry.content:
Joule for consultant (J4C) is now available for all partners to purchase and use as part of SAP’s new Per User Per Month (PUPM) price list which was launched some months ago.

The potential benefits are huge!  Consultants at SAP have already used the tool for a long time and experienced great benefits.  Read more about this on pages 7-9 in this document. Further, the pricing of J4C allows even small partners to get going without having to make huge investments and commitments. 

Here are six frequent questions I experience partners are asking:

Do I need to make a big purchase at SAP to get going with Joule for consultants?

No.  With the new PUPM pricing, the minimum purchase requirement is one user.  You pay for it by SAP AI units, which has a minimum purchase requirement of 100 AI units (with a list price of 700 euro).    And with the new “per month” commercial strategy, you can assign/commit J4C users on monthly basis, not yearly basis.  For example, you could potentially start with 1 user for a couple of months.  This limits your initial investment but allows you to start gain value and experiences with the tool.

Is there a Test, Development and Demo (TDD) for Joule for consultants?

No.  The “test” word in “TDD” is meant for partners to test customer topics in SAP LOB solutions, to be able to support customers as part of SAP’s offerings.  The situation with J4C is very different: partners will mainly use it themselves in a productive manner related to their own offerings (implementation services).  In this case, a partner as a professional service company is actually a customer of SAP.   That is why J4C is only available on the (productive) customer price list

As a partner, do I need to run an SAP LOB solution productively to install and use J4C?

No.  J4C can run stand-alone, running on a sub account of your global BTP account.  Your consultants will get a URL directly to the BTP J4C instance.  You do not need to run any other productive or TDD system from SAP.

Do I need to run a separate instance of J4C for each of my subsidiaries, or can I run it on one global instance?

You can run it on global level. As J4C is a stand alone solution (thus not related to existing TDD or productive systems), you can potentially run it on global level and provide your world wide consultants with the URL to access it. But note that you need to maintain these users in the IAS instance on SAP BTP where J4C is installed for them to get access to the tool.

What is the best target profile of a resource to use J4C?

The main target is functional and technical implementation consultants, resources who implement and provide support on SAP solutions to customers.   For example, junior consultants often need to learn a lot, they can ask J4C instead of reaching out to senior consultants who often are very busy and hard to get whole of.  Senior consultants can benefit from J4C by finding super specific information fast.  They can also benefit when doing something new at customers.  And they can be ensured they are up to date with the latest changes in SAP for a specific functional topic and following best practices.

Can I sell J4C to my customers? Some of my customers have internal SAP IT departments and/or power users who could benefit.

Yes. You can sell SAP AI units SKU 8019164 to your customers and they can start the activation process of J4C via SAP-for-me. At the moment selling the needed AI Units is possible in a CCFlex motion. Resell motion will become available second half of September.

Summary

In my opinion, starting with J4C is within reach of each SAP partner, and each partner should start on the journey to leverage the tool.

When acquiring J4C, it is important that you as partner know how to purchase AI units, where you what to run J4C (many partners has multiple SAP accounts etc),  you need to understand how to request activation in SAP-for-me, understand how the consumption of the AI units works, and you need to understand how to set J4C up SAP BTP.  For guidance on all these topics, please see this document.

entry.title: Deep Dive and Experience Sharing into SAP Joule for Developers(J4D)
entry.content:
Disclaimer: This blog is not written by any LLM.

Well, to start with, Joule for Developers, let us understand what it is?

Many people have a misconception that Joule for Developers or J4D is just an ABAP AI capability. But it is much more beyond ABAP. Joule for Developers(J4D) is collective name for the AI-powered design-time capabilities across SAP Build and ABAP

It includes new and existing features enabled by Joule in:

  1. SAP Build Code
  2. SAP Build Apps
  3. SAP Build Process Automation
  4. ABAP in SAP BTP and S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

These capabilities help developers build faster, code smarter, and automate better. Is that true? I will my honest opinion for some of them.

I have personally worked on SAP Build Apps, SAP Build Code and Joule for Developers, ABAP AI. I started with a lot of ambiguity and finally I made a mark that I could now explain it to our customers and users.

SAP Build Apps allow for generating pages to handle data entities and generate sample data automatically. It means, whenever you integrate any oData service/REST API/SAP BTP Destination, you get an option to automatically create the User Interface and also generate sample data.

SAP Build Code, has evolved through multiple iterations and seems it is still evolving. 

  • Created Fiori element app using Image
  • Created a series of projects with prompts
  • Created test data

With ABAP AI, I could create a report with the suggestions popping up in run time and that too contextually aware code prompts also known to be predictive code completion feature. We called it Ghost Code. But trust me sometimes they are really good too. 

I see the ABAP and CDS unit scripts getting generated in no time. It was good again on this parameter. 

Code explain, well I created small projects, hence feel it is good to have comments. But the true colors will be visible when you look at the repository of thousands lines of code written by someone and you have no clue of what it is. Using your skills you debug the code to understand what each block/function is doing. It is a life saver in this scenario.

SAP Build Code has the GenAI embedded as part of the service itself. There is no explicit step which need to perform other than just subscribing to this service via the Boosters (from the SAP BTP Global Account).

For SAP Build Apps and SAP Build Process Automation, everything under the new SAP Build Offering, will have the GenAI capability turned off by default. Then, how do you turn it on?

  1. Go to your SAP BTP Subaccount and access the SAP Build Apps and SAP Build Process Automation service from the 'Instances and Subscription' option
  2. SAP Build Lobby will openStep 1 - Access SAP Build Lobby

  3. Now go to the 'Control Tower' in the right hand side panel, last option and then click on the 'Generative AI' tile in the top row, right hand side 'Tenant Configuration'Step 2 - Click on Control Tower Option in Left Hand Pane

  4. Switch on the toggle button of Generative AI
    Step 3 - Click on Generative AI tile in the right hand pane

  5. Read the AI Terms and Conditions and scroll to the bottom of the Terms and Conditions to enable the checkbox of 'I have read the terms and conditions' - this is called as 'Scroll wrap agreement' in the language of Law - it means you agree to the Terms and Conditions and read till the last of the agreement.

    Step 5 - Read/Scroll to the end of the AI Terms & Conditions

  6. Click on the checkbox of 'I have read the terms and conditions'  

    Step 6 - Click on 'Accept' button on the right hand bottom corner

  7. Now click on the 'Accept' button 

    Step 4 - Turn on the toggle of Enable Generative AI features

  8. That's it. Now you can explore the GenAI capability inside SAP Build Apps and SAP Build Process Automation.

Some people have questions whether they need to sign a 0 USD AI Terms and Conditions contract to activate the GenAI capability for J4D. The answer is, except for 'Joule for Developers ABAP AI' capability, you do NOT need to sign an explicit contract for AI Terms and Conditions. They are all embedded within the services.

Well this will be an evolving document, where I will keep updating my reviews on each of these services mentioned. Stay tuned!

entry.title: Give your Joule Agents 🤖 the gift of Memory 💭, with Hana Cloud ✨
entry.content:
When Joule agents can write/read memories in SAP HANA Cloud, they:

  • Remember business facts at scale (supplier habits, contract quirks, SLA exceptions) ✅

  • Retrieve them fast & accurately with HANA Cloud Vector Engine ⚡

  • Keep memories human-readable, sortable, and dead-simple to implement 🧩

That means fewer repeated mistakes, smarter suggestions, and agents that actually learn with your business over time.

An example of some memories for an invoice exception agent.
You can make them as detailed or a simple as you want in the agent prompt!

 

 

How it works

  1. A simple “Memories” table

    Human-readable text + metadata (who/what it’s about, when learned, importance, TTL, etc.).

    Optional: a vector column for semantic search.

  2. Vector search for recall

    Store an embedding of each memory → use approximate nearest neighbor (ANN) to fetch the right facts instantly (“Which supplier often uses expired POs?”). BM25 or other strategies are available. I love BM25's reliability for same-language and same-topic knowledge meshes.

  3. One tool your agent calls

    Add a tool (below) so your agent can append or update memories whenever it learns something new.

  4. Update the Agent prompt to have it use the memory well!

           Something like:

Before answering, search (memory.search_hana) with a concise query (supplier/invoice/PO terms; limit top_k≤8); 
use the results to tailor your response. 
Only write when you learn a new, stable, factual business detail; 
upsert (memory.upsert_hana) instead of inserting duplicates—treat as duplicate if normalized context matches or vector similarity ≥0.86 and the same entity (supplier/invoice/PO) is involved; 
if duplicate, refresh last_seen_at (and occurrence_count if available). Format memories as one dense sentence in context 
(e.g., YYYY-MM-DD | INV-XXXX | Supplier ABC | PO 4500001123 | 4,980.00 EUR | expired PO used) 
and a brief actionable description; keep context ≤220 chars, use present tense. 
Set importance 1–5 (5 = critical risk) and ttl_days (low importance decays, 0 = never expires). 
Do not store ephemeral chatter or sensitive data; prefer patterns over one-offs. 
If you update or add a memory, mention it briefly to the user; otherwise be concise and never dump full tables unless asked.

 

Add two memory tools (Joule Skills)

"Add Memory" is a simple SQL Write

"Retrieve Memory" is a simple SQL Read, with semantic search (BM25+Embeddings)

 

 

Advanced memory patterns (that HANA makes easy) 🚀

  • Disappearing memories (decay/TTL): small quirks fade unless they’re re-observed.

  • Hierarchical memories: supplier-site → supplier → region → global policy.

  • World representations: keep a simple graph of relationships (supplier↔plant, approver↔cost center), or materialize views for fast joins.

  • Learning from mistakes: tag memories with resolution outcome so the agent prefers strategies that worked.

 

Result:

A living, human-readable knowledge fabric your Joule agents can trust.
It's fast, explainable, and always improving. ✨

entry.title: Getting Ready for AI-Assisted Applicant Screening in SAP SuccessFactors
entry.content:
Getting Ready for AI-Assisted Applicant Screening in SAP SuccessFactors

Recruiting is one of the most time-consuming parts of HR. For many companies, every new job role attracts hundreds of CVs. Recruiters spend hours reading applications, hiring managers get frustrated waiting for shortlists, and candidates often feel lost in the process.

SAP SuccessFactors has introduced a new feature — AI-assisted applicant screening, powered by Joule — to make this easier. The idea is simple: the system can read applications, match skills to the job, and even rank candidates from best to least fit. This has the potential to change how recruiters work, but there is something important to understand.

This feature does not simply work out of the box. To get value from it, you first need to set up some important building blocks in your system.

What you need before enabling AI-assisted screening

Over the last few months of working with clients, I have seen that the success of AI-assisted screening depends on six key areas:

1. Recruiting Management (RCM)

This is the foundation. Without properly structured job requisitions, application templates, and candidate profiles, there is no data for AI to work on.

2. Job Profile Builder (JPB)

Job Profile Builder is where you define jobs, roles, competencies, and required skills. The better this is set up, the stronger the AI matching will be. Think of it as the dictionary that AI uses to understand your jobs.

3. Talent Intelligence Hub (TIH)

This is becoming more and more important. TIH provides a single skills framework across the system. When jobs and candidates speak the same “skills language,” the AI can make much better decisions about fit and ranking.

4. Joule with AI Units License

Joule is the intelligence layer inside SAP SuccessFactors. With the AI Units license, Joule can power features such as skills extraction, candidate-job matching, stack ranking, and even generating interview questions. Without Joule and the license, the feature cannot be enabled.

5. Role-Based Permissions (RBP)

Permissions are often overlooked. Recruiters and hiring managers need access to view AI insights, while system administrators need access to configure and monitor AI services.

6. Clean and consistent data

The simplest, but often the hardest step. If job descriptions are vague, or candidate data is incomplete, the AI will not give useful results. Clean data is the backbone of any successful AI implementation.

Why stack ranking makes a difference

The most useful feature of AI-assisted screening is stack ranking. This means applicants are automatically sorted from best fit to least fit based on the job requirements and the skills framework.

This helps in many ways:

  • Recruiters save time by not manually scanning hundreds of CVs.

  • Hiring managers get a clear shortlist and understand why certain candidates are ranked higher.

  • Every applicant is checked in the same way, which makes the process more consistent and fair.

  • Recruiters get more time to focus on meaningful conversations with candidates instead of repetitive screening tasks.

A real example from practice

One global technology company I worked with introduced AI-assisted screening for their campus hiring. They received thousands of applications for a single drive. Normally, this would take recruiters several weeks to manage.

With stack ranking enabled, the system automatically highlighted the most relevant candidates. The results:

  • Screening time reduced by 40 percent

  • Recruiters could finally spend more time engaging with students

  • Hiring managers felt the shortlist was of much higher quality

The company is now planning to extend this approach to experienced hiring as well.

Final thoughts

AI-assisted applicant screening in SAP SuccessFactors is not about replacing recruiters. It is about helping them focus on people, not paperwork.

But success depends on getting the basics right. Recruiting Management, Job Profile Builder, Talent Intelligence Hub, Joule with AI Units, Role-Based Permissions, and clean data — these are the real prerequisites.

Once these are in place, stack ranking can truly change the way hiring teams work — making recruitment faster, fairer, and more consistent.

entry.content:
在 SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 中，SAP 提供了三类核心的基础AI (BASE AI) 功能，旨在简化日常操作并提升用户体验。最重要的是——这些功能无需额外成本。它们可通过 BASE AI 包免费开通，或已包含在您的标准云订阅中，提供无限制访问，且无需购买额外的 AI 单元。

本文将详细介绍这三种基础 AI 功能的范围，以及如何开通和获取相应的技术指导。​

提示​​：以下 AI 功能尚未在中国大陆地区上线，建议您咨询您的 SAP 客户经理以获取最新信息。

 

Joule 基础 AI 功能 (Joule Base AI Features)

Joule 是 SAP 的“一站式”AI 副驾驶，旨在通过提供直观、个性化和智能的用户体验来简化日常工作。Joule 拥有一系列覆盖 SAP 云应用程序的技能和能力，目标是支持 80% 最常用的任务和业务流程。

Joule 的基础 AI 功能主要通过以下三种交互模式提供能力：

  • ​​信息型 (Informational Capabilities)​​：Joule 提供简明扼要的帮助内容摘要，以有效回答用户通过自然语言提出的问题。
  • ​​导航型 (Navigational Capabilities)​​：Joule 推荐相关应用程序，并促进无缝导航，使用户能够执行其业务流程。SAP Cloud ERP 中有超过 500 个导航场景。
  • ​​事务型 (Transactional Capabilities)​​：Joule 提供关于业务对象的深入信息，无需打开相应的应用程序。事务性交互使用户能够访问后端系统并管理业务任务，直接在对话中查看和操作业务对象。SAP Cloud ERP 中有超过 45 个事务场景。
开通方式：

您可以通过SAP Store自助下单免费的SKU或者联系您的销售代表为您下单。

请访问 SAP Store 页面了解并开通Joule 基础 AI 授权

技术设置官方文档​​：
  1. 初始设置Initial Setup
  2. Joule 入门指南Joule Onboarding Guide
  3. 与 SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 的集成Integration with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

​​ SAP 也提供了基于Discovery Center Missions​​的指导任务，帮助您一步步理解完成Joule 配置的必要步骤：

  1. 创建Joule实例Establish a Unified Joule Instance
  2. 激活 Joule 与 SAP Cloud ERP Activate Joule with SAP Cloud ERP 

 

嵌入式基础 AI 功能 (Embedded Base AI Features)

这些 AI 功能直接嵌入在您的云 ERP 模块中，主要应用于用户体验等领域，通过自动化和简化任务来改善操作效率。

功能范围：
  • ​​智能摘要 (Smart Summarization)​​：对基于 Fiori Elements 的业务对象进行智能摘要。
  • ​​简易筛选 (Easy Filter)​​：允许用户通过自然语言描述所需数据来筛选列表报告，适用于超过 1100 份报告。
  • ​​企业搜索 (Enterprise Search)​​：支持用户使用自然语言进行企业搜索。
开通方式：

开通嵌入式基础 AI 功能的步骤如下：

  • 注册并接受 SAP AI 条款​​：由客户 S-User 或合作伙伴的 S-User 注册并接受 SAP AI 条款。此操作只需执行一次，适用于 SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 的所有系统和租户。
  • SAP 启动激活​​：在您接受条款后，SAP 将启动 AI 功能的激活并通知您。
系统配置：

针对这些功能，SAP 提供了详细的配置指南和用户指南：

  • 智能摘要：配置指南 和用户指南
  • 简易筛选：配置指南 和用户指南
  • 企业搜索：配置指南 和用户指南

 

机器学习基础 AI 场景 (Machine Learning Base AI Features)

这些机器学习功能作为基础 AI 的一部分提供，旨在自动化和简化特定的业务流程，无需额外的许可证费用和申请。

功能范围：

  • ​​销售订单提取 (Sales Order Extraction, Scope Item 4X9)​​：

能够自动从 PDF 或图像格式的采购订单文件中创建销售订单（非结构化数据）。

  • 销售订单自动完成 (Sales Order Auto Completion, Scope Item 73P)​​：

为销售文档中缺失的数据提供建议，加快销售订单和客户退货订单的文档完成。

开通方式：

这些机器学习功能作为嵌入式基础 AI 功能的一部分，无需额外许可证即可使用。它们已包含在标准云订阅中，提供无限制访问。

配置指导：

销售订单提取Create Sales Orders - Automatic Extraction | SAP Help Portal

销售订单自动完成Recommendation-Assisted Sales Order Completion | SAP Help Portal

 

SAP Cloud ERP 的嵌入式基础 AI 功能、Joule 基础 AI 功能以及机器学习基础 AI 场景旨在通过提高最终用户满意度、改进生产力和节省时间来提升您的业务效率。由于它们包含在标准BASE AI订阅中且无需额外费用，我们鼓励您探索并激活这些功能，以充分利用 SAP 在人工智能方面的投资。
