entry.title: Reinventing Customer Engagement : How SAP Joule Premium CX Shopping Agent Transforms Digital Sales
entry.content:
Introduction

AI agents are powerful tools designed to perform tasks autonomously, effectively mimicking human decision-making processes. Their integration into various business operations and everyday activities is rapidly increasing. So, what defines an AI agent?

AI agents are sophisticated software programs that leverage algorithms, data analysis, and machine learning techniques to carry out tasks that typically demand human intelligence. They are capable of reasoning, learning from experiences, and adapting to new challenges.

AI agents are categorized into several distinct types, including:

  • Chatbots
  • Virtual assistants
  • Recommendation systems
  • Autonomous vehicles And more

Each type has a specific purpose, and together, they significantly enhance efficiency and elevate user experiences.

AI agents have found applications across multiple sectors like Retail, wholesale, healthcare, finance, entertainment and home devices etc.  

SAP's Generative AI Initiatives focus on embedding generative AI across its enterprise solutions to enhance productivity, automation, customer experience and decision-making.

Here’s a concise overview:

Joule AI Copilot: A core component, Joule is a natural language generative AI assistant integrated into SAP’s portfolio, including SAP S/4HANA, SAP SuccessFactors, SAP Customer Experience (CX), and more.

SAP CX AI Toolkit: Tailored for Customer Experience solutions (e.g., SAP Commerce Cloud, SAP Sales Cloud), this toolkit leverages generative AI for smart product recommendations, dynamic pricing, personalized search, and automated content creation (e.g., product descriptions, marketing emails). It integrates enterprise data with AI models to drive personalization and efficiency.

SAP Business AI: This broader initiative embeds generative AI across SAP’s cloud solutions, including ERP, supply chain, and HR. Key features include:

AI initiative on SAP Customer Experience

The SAP Customer Experience (CX) AI Initiative focuses on integrating advanced artificial intelligence, particularly generative AI, into SAP’s Customer Experience solutions to enhance sales, e-commerce, customer service, and marketing.

SAP CX AI Toolkit: A suite of AI-powered tools that integrates with SAP CX applications (e.g., SAP Commerce Cloud, SAP Sales Cloud) to automate tasks, provide real-time insights, and deliver personalized customer experiences. It leverages enterprise data, proprietary AI models, and large language models (LLMs) for features like smart product recommendations, Customer reviews Sentimental analysis, Visual search and personalized shopping agent  , and automated  product content creation.

Pleaser refer the blog for CX AI toolkit features CX AI in E-Commerce: Transforming Customer Journey... - SAP Community .In this blog, we will explore the shopping agent

The SAP Commerce Cloud CX AI Toolkit Shopping Agent is an artificial intelligence-driven conversational tool aimed at improving the e-commerce experience on the SAP Commerce Cloud platform.

This conversational AI assistant operates as a well-informed digital sales representative, accessible around the clock on your storefront.

By utilizing generative AI and natural language processing, it offers personalized and seamless customer interactions, facilitating product discovery and increasing conversion rates. The shopping agent assists customers in locating the appropriate products through engaging conversations that include relevant pricing information. Additionally, it answers inquiries regarding products, enables product comparisons, allows items to be added to the cart, and provides updates on placed order.

Commerce Product Discovery challenge which are addressed by Shopping Agent 

10% of customers find exactly what they’re searching for every time

80% of customers leave websites because search didn’t meet expectations

 

 

Traditional commerce gives customer a categories-based search, large number of products to filter manually and fail to provide the granular details of product which they are looking for, making them guess and buy or leave the journey

Using shopping agents, eCommerce customers can meet their key buying journey demands

  • A guiding agent to support their broader mission like” I need to purchase for this project”
  • The support to help them to reach the product with specific requirements quickly
  • Assisting them in building and completing the shopping mission by suggesting the product set of solution comprise of set of products 
  • Overall, a digital sales associate which helps
    • To have Natural conversation about needs
    • Understands broad scenarios/ Specific requirements
    • Ask questions and get relevant answers about product 
    • Recommends complementary products
    • Compares features & pricing
    • Helping them to finish the purchase and track the same
       

      B2B and B2C Scenarios are handled by Shopping Agent 

B2C Sample Scenarios:

  • A customer asks, “Can you recommend a waterproof jacket for under $100?” The Shopping Agent responds with tailored recommendations by pulling real-time data from the product catalog and other sources available on Azure Cloud.
  • Customers can also start with broader queries, such as, "Can you suggest some outfits for a summer vacation?" They can ask the Shopping Agent to recommend appropriate sizes, for example, "What size of formal wear would be suitable for someone who is 174 cm tall and weighs 65 kg?"
  • Additionally, customers may inquire about accessories that complement their main outfit, asking, "Can you suggest formal shoes or a handbag that would go well with this dress?"
  • Customers can also ask about the material of a dress, maintenance tips, and suggestions for appropriate occasions to wear specific outfits.

B2B Sample Scenarios:

  • B2B customer inquiry about bulk pricing and compatibility for a specific Model of engineering tool. The agent provides instant answers and suggests related items, streamlining the purchase process
  • B2B customer can ask about the product comparison, volume price options  -Can you compare the motors Sharp PowerE 22i  and  Sharp PowerE 11i?
  • B2B customer can ask about the warranty, annual maintenance terms and contract cost for the engineering tool – “Suggest me the annual maintenance contract options for the Troponin Analyzer” or “can you guide me on the installation procedure for Siemens Chemistry AnalyzerA500 ?
  • B2B customers may the compatible accessories for the product – “Can you suggest the accessories to setup the Rotary Hammer?”
  • B2B customers may also ask to order product to cart and check the status of the latest order –“ Can you add the Switch gear EV550C to cart?”  or “Can you tell me status of my last order?”
  • B2B customers may ask non product information to the agent - “Direct me to FAQ document  or  guide me on payment /refund terms”  

Core Capabilities of the SAP CX AI Toolkit Shopping Agent

Shopping agent caters the following three boarder areas.

Specific Requests: I need products with these specific features

Broader Scenarios: I need equipment for this project

Complete Solutions: Help me build a complete solution

 

Digital Service Agent offers the following, 

  • User-friendly configuration interface for creating and customizing self-service agent
  • Ability to easily download and access chat history via the Agent Builder UI
  • Handoff to Support Channel for complex issues or user-requested human assistance, ensuring a smooth transition for effective problem resolution
  • Create a support ticket, complete with a detailed conversation summary, when the agent is unable to resolve the issue
  • AI-powered self-service using product documentation and FAQ’s through natural conversation
  • Plug into the digital outlet of your choice such as a Business Portal or e-commerce storefront through a flexible API

Benefits of using shopping agent

Modular: Shopping Agent is modular, powered by combing the one or many of sub-agents which serves unique purpose, (PriceRecommendationAgent, Add to Cart Agent, Order Status Agent, Self Service Agent). Admin can activate/deactivate the sub-agents during configuration based on the business needs 

Flexibility on utilizing information to guide the customer:  Shopping Agent utilizes the information from the following sources to guide the customer 

  • Commerce product content management (tag, description, attributes, price, media and description) 
  • Product documentation such as installation guides, warranty and Maintenace guides attached as document in PCM or any external sources like Azure Media
  • Any internal (commerce cloud) or external location which serves non product information 
  • Order status and shipping information on order history 
  • Service ticket information from Service Cloud or Commerce Cloud

 Natural Language Interaction:  The Shopping Agent enables customers to engage in natural, conversational queries about products, such as details on features, pricing, availability, or compatibility. It understands complex, multi-part requests, mimicking the expertise of an in-store assistant.

Seamless Integration with SAP Commerce Cloud and external resources like Azure

The Shopping Agent is fully embedded within the SAP ecosystem, allowing it to leverage enterprise data from SAP Commerce Cloud, also connect with external systems like Microsoft Azure Blob Storage for enhanced functionality

Multilingual Support

   The agent supports multiple languages and enables facilitates global customer engagement by generating content in the customer’s preferred language or matching the input language

 Enhanced Product Discovery by incorporating ask the product

 Features like “Ask About a Product” allow customers to pose specific questions (e.g., about materials or care instructions) and receive instant responses, improving the shopping experience.

Enterprise-Grade Security

   - The agent ensures data privacy by preventing the storage of customer data in third-party large language models (LLMs) or SAP models. It uses secure data retrieval from SAP CX sources, with features like context grounding and PII (Personally Identifiable Information) obfuscation.

Shopping Agent – Reference Architecture

Shopping Agent Implementation Steps:

 

Shopping Agent – Roadmap

Here the list of roadmap capabilities

  • Ask questions about product availability and the ability to exclude out of stock products from recommendations.
  • Order status includes tracking numbers
  • Automatically recognize product-specific questions on product detail pages. Product pages display clickable, AI-generated questions to start agent conversations
  • Power product recommendations and complementary suggestions using external catalog data
  • Support for Q&A from PDF documents stored as media or classification attributes.

Resources to refer

  • Learning: Utilizing SAP CX AI Toolkit for SAP Commerce Cloud 
  • Doc 
    •  SAP CX AI Toolkit Features | SAP Help Portal 
    • User Guide | SAP Help Portal
  • Webcast: https://gateway.on24.com/wcc/eh/2983783/lp/4635850/master-your-product-catalog-with-business-ai-for-...
  • YouTube: SAP CX AI Toolkit - YouTube 
  • CX AI Toolkit blog: Integrating SAP CX AI Toolkit with SAP Commerce Cl... - SAP Community
  • Source code:   source code is ready to use (composable storefront only) - Open-source code* HERE

 Conclusion

Shopping Agent empowers customers by supporting diverse shopping scenarios, from specific product searches to broader project needs, improving conversion rates, enhancing customer satisfaction, and facilitating a more efficient shopping experience.  Hope the information is useful, if  you like to explore, please reach out to your SAP representative. 

Thank you for your time!

TRANSCRIPTION

[Intro] This is the SAP Developer News for September 4th, 2025.

[Witalij] If you see me wearing this T-shirt, you can be sure it's about AI. And you are absolutely right. This announcement has been wildly shared this week, but in case you missed it, we at SAP have introduced MCP servers to bring the Model Context Protocol into enterprise application development. The emerging open standard Mobile Context Protocol defines how large-language models can access tools and project context in a secure and structured way. Three servers are now available. For the Cloud Application Programming Model, for SAP Fiori Elements, and for SAPUI5. Let's double-click on each of them. The CAPMCP server has been released as open source under the Apache 2.0 license. It provides two tools for AI-assisted development of CAP applications, one to search across the compiled CDS model and one to search the CAP documentation. The Fiori MCP server lets AI agents generate and edit Fiori applications, discover apps in the workspace, and follow built-in rules that enforce best practices. This speeds up prototyping and makes iterations easier. The server is actually available as an experimental release. The UI5 MCP server equips your AI agents with six tools. This range from best practice guidelines and product scaffolding to searching the API reference, linking code and fixing deprecated APIs, providing insights into the project details. By releasing the CUP server as open source and extending MCP to Fiori and UI5, we are building an ecosystem where AI agents can actively support enterprise development. To learn more, we invite you to explore the CAP MCP server on GitHub, try out the UI5 and Fiori Elements servers in your own projects, and share your feedback on SAP community. And be sure to follow upcoming updates in SAP Build Code to see how Joule continues to expand MCP-based scenarios. By the way, if you are interested in AI agents, this month I will be presenting this very topic at SAP Meetup in Luz, in Poland, and at SAP Insight Track in Porto, Portugal. See you then.

[Nora] I have some great news for our listeners with a Learning Hub subscription, because the AI advocacy team is hosting a live session called Step-by-Step Guidance to Extend Joule by Joule Studio in SAP Build. It's going to take place on the 16th of September at 11 Central European Summertime, 11 a.m. It's targeted at developers. It's going to be a hands-on session that will teach you everything you need to know about Joule Studio, how to build your custom skills, how to integrate it into other systems, and how to test and deploy your skill. And it's targeted at beginners. So make sure you sign up and learn from the experts themselves.

[M K, Sheena] By leveraging the SAP BTP ABAP environment and the ABAP RESTful Application Programming model, you can build applications side-by-side to SAP solutions such as SAP S/4HANA Cloud. This GitHub repository provides a sample partner reference application called Music Festival Manager to build, deploy, and run side-by-side multi-tenant applications based on the SAP EVTP APAC Cloud to extend and integrate with SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud. These applications ensure SAP standards for enterprise-grade business solutions and also offers a consistent, harmonized user experience. The advantages include a clean code for a page safety, a scalable cloud development model, and secure integration with SAP S/4HANA Cloud. In addition to the step-by-step tutorial, it also includes sizing guides, build materials, best practices, and tools for building multi-tenant extensions. Check out the GitHub repository link in the description box below and start building your enterprise create SaaS applications today.

entry.title: Transformative Lessons from SAP NOW AI Tour Argentina
entry.content:
On August 28th, SAP brought its renowned SAP NOW AI Tour to Argentina, offering a unique opportunity for local professionals to engage with cutting-edge AI innovations. We had the honor of participating in sessions where more than 1,000 experts shared their innovative ideas, experiences, and case studies. The event featured an extensive catalogue of talks, covering a wide range of topics related to various fields of interest regarding AI, ensuring there was something valuable for everyone. In the following sections, I will share my personal insights and reflections on the talks I attended and the overall event.

Reflecting on the occasion, the word that comes to mind is "transformative" due to the profound impact of the event. On one hand, it was a huge source of inspiration: new ideas, visions, interesting strategies, and personal experiences were shared. On the other hand, it provided practical insights through real cases and projects. This means that all the experts were capable of delivering not only an aspirational message, but also some proof that served as a truthful outcome.

One of the strongest ideas presented during the event was the notion of a virtuous circle created by the integration of applications, data, and artificial intelligence. We were shown how these elements, when working together, can generate outcomes that are more resilient, more sustainable, and more efficient. What struck me the most is that this perspective positioned AI not as something external or distant, but as an element that can and should be embedded into our everyday processes. For a company like ours, this confirmed that the future of AI lies in making it part of the very foundation of the business.

Another highlight was seeing Joule, and the different ways in which it is already being applied. We learned that it has the potential to simplify a great portion of repetitive tasks, allowing teams to dedicate their time and creativity to areas that truly generate value. 

Finally, the reflections on responsible AI gave the sessions a deeper meaning. Beyond the technical demonstrations, there was a constant reminder of the importance of building systems that are transparent and trustworthy. For me, this emphasis on ethics was essential: it reminded us that innovation must go hand in hand with accountability, especially when the goal is to design solutions that people will rely on every day. 

Despite the diversity of experts and talks, a common theme emerged: there is no single correct way to achieve success. The real challenge is to find the method, the technique, the strategy that best works for you. About the topic, experts at the event encouraged us to take advantage of all the tools and resources available to build an efficient ecosystem that adapts to our needs and showcases our uniqueness.

Connected with what was said above, this phrase resonated with me the most: you have to pluck up the courage and just do things. Success is the best teacher for failure. In order to succeed in something, it is necessary to conceive the idea of failing as something inevitable – and indispensable – and to include it within the planning towards a goal. Otherwise, the frustration will be not only unbearable, but we will forget about how important it is for our progress. Where would we take the valuable lessons from, if not from failing time after time? Consider this: if you are not experiencing failures, it might indicate that you are not challenging yourself or progressing. A lack of failure could mean that you are stuck in the same place.

And what about you? Have you attended the SAP AI Tour yet? When is it coming to your city? Have you learned anything that has impacted the way you view AI? What are your expectations if you are planning to attend this event in the future?

entry.title: SAP S/4HANA Cloud for group reporting - Release 2508 is generally available
entry.content:
We’re continuing our strategic investment in group reporting to simplify financial closing, enhance user experience, and accelerate your consolidation process. Today, we’re pleased to announce the release of SAP S/4HANA Cloud for group reporting version 2508 launched on August 18, 2025. This latest release introduces powerful new features and integrates business AI capabilities into your software.

Key new and enhanced features in 2508 include:

  • Integration of Joule, our AI copilot, in group reporting
  • AI-assisted insights for group financial statement review booklet
  • Integration with SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC)
  • New consolidation auto post rules engine app
  • One-click consolidation in a new consolidation monitor app
  • Customer-defined sign convention
  • Accountant-friendly display of manual journal entries in debit-credit
  • Integration of balance validations and notifications in GRDC package
  • Export questions and answers from GRDC forms
  • Ability to enter or load reported data for dimension totals
  • Cross-version validations and dynamic version comparison in analytics
  • And many more improvements on data collection, data quality, analytics and master data

Download our feature deck.

-
Integration of Joule, our AI copilot, in Group Reporting

Joule is SAP’s AI copilot - leveraging its generative AI capabilities, Joule aims to understand your requests, retrieve information, and complete your tasks in a conversational way. For example, instead of manually navigating to a feature or page buried deep, you can describe the current task to Joule, who can help automate tasks or take you to places where you can find desired data. By using Joule, you can easily interact with the system and increase your productivity.

Group Reporting now integrates with two Joule capabilities.

Since June 2025, Group Reporting integrates with Joule's informational capability. This conversational search capability helps you retrieve necessary information from the SAP Help Portal or documents uploaded to the Joule service if you've set up Document Grounding. Joule searches available Group Reporting documentation and it's own knowledge base to find the answer to your query and summarizes the search results and provides the summarization as the answer to your question, along with the top three search results.

 

 

 

 

Released in version 2508, Joule’s navigational capability is now integrated in Group Reporting. This capability helps you find and navigate to the Group Reporting functionality or apps you're looking for without having to go through multiple links to reach a destination. ​With Joule, you can easily navigate across Group Reporting with navigational interactions. ​Joule offers a navigational link that opens the relevant app and interface in a new browser tab. At the destination, you can continue from where you left off, with your previous conversation history.

Below is an example of navigation with Joule in Group Reporting. You're finished working on exchange rates (1), and tell Joule you'd "like to see group journal entry" (2) . Our AI copilot proposes three possible apps either to post or display journal entries. As you want to create a new journal entry, you just select the Post Group Journal Entries app and (3) Joule opens it.

More information: Joule informational capability, Document grounding, Joule navigational capability

-
AI-assisted insights for group financial statement review booklet

With version 2508, you can now use AI-generated analyses and summaries of your data in the Group Financial Statements Review Booklet app. You can use AI-assisted business insights for the Profit & Loss (nature of expense) and access it in the side panel. Based on the data displayed, you can do the following AI-assisted analyses: bottom-line growth, EBIT, EBITDA, financial result, operating income/loss, profitability, top-line growth and currency variance.

Business insights combine drilldown and filter actions with AI prompts, accessing large language model in SAP Business Technology Platform. They automate navigation and provide you with explanations of the data. Business insights answer predefined business questions and provides you with summarized information on your financial statements, including comments.

More information: AI-Assisted Business Insights in 'Group Financial Statements Review Booklet' App

-
Integration with SAP Business Data Cloud

SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC) leverages our extensive portfolio of business applications and our customers’ diverse data architectures to create a unified, semantically rich data environment built on a single semantic model. This environment serves as the data foundation for our AI-First strategy and is planned to become the preferred gateway for customers to extract data from SAP and non-SAP systems.

As depicted in the diagram below, in addition to the integration with BDC Analytics Cloud, in 2025 we strengthened Group Reporting integration with BDC by delivering content for Datasphere and integrating Group Reporting Data Collection (GRDC) with Datasphere.

 

Delivered in Q1-2025, the Group Reporting content in Datasphere allows to perform reporting on consolidated data within BDC. The content package includes the following (see screenshot below):

  • Extraction of Group Reporting master data
  • Extraction of Group Reporting raw transactional data
  • Group Reporting logic built in SAP Datasphere

The data model is implemented based on the data structures used in Group Reporting and leverages standard CDS views to extract and load data. It covers among others version relations including extension versions, group derivation logic based on group structure as well as hierarchy elimination. With the help of this content package, you can integrate your Group Reporting data with other data sets within Datasphere. Please note the reporting items and reporting rules are not yet be part of the content. We plan to remove this restriction together with this related innovation on reporting rules.

In September 2025 with version 2508.2, we'll deliver BDC integration in Group Reporting Data Collection (GRDC). With this new feature, you can use Datasphere as a source in your data mapping definition. You have the ability to load data from Datasphere into Group Reporting with GRDC mapping. You can define new sources for Datasphere models, and use defined sources in GRDC. 

More information: Group Reporting content in Datasphere, Datasphere integration in GRDC

-
New consolidation auto post rules engine

You now benefit from a new rule engine to automate your consolidation postings. This engine is inspired by SAP Financial Consolidation and aims to offer the same level of power and flexibility valued by its users. 

We increased flexibility of the rule definition compared to existing consolidation rules:

  • Flexible definition of source data
  • Assignment of multiple document types in one task
  • Multiple posting lines
  • Flexible definition of the target data (field assignment, value calculation)
  • Inclusion of the results of previous rule steps as an option
  • Enhanced partner filter for intra-unit eliminations
  • Field Assignment option Value Of to post on partner fields
  • Inclusion of Rules to Nodes and Rule Groups
  • Flexible assignment of Rule Groups to the Tasks
  • Modern Task Log

Since June 2025, you can leverage our new rule engine to automate postings for consolidation units for local close (posting levels 00, 0C, 01, 10). Check out here for more information.

With version 2508, you can now also use our new rule engine to automate inter-unit eliminations for pairwise elimination (posting level 20). This feature enables you to automatically post group journal entries for pairs of consolidation units by running consolidation tasks in the consolidation monitor. It allows you to eliminate intercompany transactions, such as sales, other income/expenses, and accounts receivable/accounts payable, for example. 

As we move forward in 2025, we plan to release incremental innovations to automate consolidation group–related postings in the consolidation monitor on posting level 30, and replace reclassifications on posting level 30 (see our roadmap). 

More information:

  • Manage Rules for Automatic Postings
  • Assign Rule Groups for Automatic Postings
  • Display Logs for Automatic Postings
  • Import/Export Current Settings
  • Automatic Postings for Pairs of Consolidation Units
  • Automate consolidation group–related postings | SAP Roadmap 

-
One-click consolidation in a new consolidation monitor app

Available since June 2025, we deliver a new version of the Consolidation Monitor. You can now work in a modern user interface powered by the latest Fiori technology, including features like filtering and sorting.

To enhance your closing process experience, you're able to perform several actions with just one click – for example, you can carry out a full consolidation or open and close periods effortlessly (see the screenshot below). You can improve usability by switching from the existing app to this new version with its updated interface. You're able to increase efficiency by performing actions across multiple values, including tasks, groups, and periods. Additionally, you can streamline operations by opening or closing multiple periods, running full consolidations, and automating task processing through task scheduling.

More information: One-click consolidation in a new consolidation monitor app

-
Customer-defined sign convention

From 2508.1 release, planned in September 2025, you'll be able to define your own sign logic, instead of the SAP sign logic. The SAP sign logic interprets positive amounts for each financial statement item as debit amounts and negative amounts as credit amounts. For instance, revenue is stored as a negative amount. With 2508.1, you can specify if the financial statement items should be posted as debit amounts or credit amounts.

​You can select the default sign behavior of your financial statement items:

  • Debit item: a positive number is a debit
  • Credit item: a positive number is a credit

For example, you can opt for the following sign convention:

  • Assets are debit financial statement items: gross values are entered as positive amounts; amortization, depreciation and impairment are entered as negative amounts
  • Equity & liabilities are credit: amounts are entered as positive amounts
  • Income statement are credit: revenues are entered as positive amounts, expenses as negative amounts

In this example, the movements (subitems) behave as follows:

  • Assets /Gross values and Equity & Liabilities: increases are entered as positive amounts, decreases
    as negative amounts
  • Assets /Amort. Depr. & Impairment: increases are entered as negative amounts, decreases as positive
    amount

More information: Configurable sign convention for data inputs and data processing  

-
Accountant-friendly display of manual journal entries in debit-credit

Available since June 2025, we enhanced the usability of the "Post Group Journal Entries" app. You can choose to enter manual group journals with a Debit/Credit indicator and sign-free amounts. When you activate this new layout, the manual journal entry is more accountant-oriented. This new feature changes only the display of the journals; it doesn’t change the way they're stored in the database. It's also applied to previously posted journals.

More information: Debit/Credit Indicator in the Manual Group Journal Entries Apps 

-
Integration of balance validations and notifications in GRDC package

We continue to deliver on the integration of the Data Monitor capabilities in Group Reporting Data Collection (GRDC) package. In addition to the integration of the release, data collection, annual net income and line validation tasks, in 2508 you can now benefit from the balance validation task integration in your package. With this integration, you're able to control the consistency of your consolidation unit reported data directly in the package.

Typical balance validations in GRDC include:

  • Assets equal Equity and Liabilities
  • Gross value of assets higher or equal to depreciation and impairment
  • Exhaustive breakdown of investment in subsidiaries by shares
  • Complete analysis of investment in subsidiaries, net equity or assets and liabilities by movements

You can use balance validations effectively in a staggered consolidation approach, where you use GRDC to collect data step by step in a phased manner. You define multiple data entry steps within a package. Each step targets a specific type of data and validations (like P&L, Balance Sheet, Intercompany, or Disclosures) and you're able to schedule them in a specific order. This lets you validate and complete each phase before moving to the next, ensuring data quality and control throughout the close process.

In addition, you can now receive notifications for the tasks you run for a package in the GRDC Enter Package Data app. These notifications keep you informed about the status and progress of your tasks, for example, reported data validation task. The task can be underway or completed successfully, with warning or with errors (see screenshot below).

More information: GRDC - Integrate balance validation task into the package, and receive notifications 

-
Export questions and answers from GRDC forms

In 2508.2, you'll be able to export all Q&A and text entered in GRDC Forms via the new Export Questions and Answers app.

When you add questions to your Forms, you collect additional textual information that becomes part of the financial data submitted to the Group. With the new Export Q&A to CSV function, you can easily extract all responses and use them for deeper insights, reporting, or decision-making. This makes it easier for you to work with qualitative data alongside your financial results.

Exporting Q&A is simple. Just follow these steps:

  1. Open the Export Package Data app.
  2. Use the filters at the top to select the Package you want to export.
  3. Click the Create QA Export button. You’ll see the progress in the task list.
  4. Once the task is finished, a Download button will appear.
  5. Click the Download button to save the CSV file directly to your desktop.

More information: Export Q&A from GRDC

-
Ability to enter or load reported data for dimension totals

With version 2508, when you upload data (using the GRDC Data Mapping or Import Reported Data apps) or when you input data manually (in the GRDC Enter Package Data app) you can now choose to activate the Total Mode option to load reported data with some missing dimension values. The total value of such a dimension is then aggregated without changing the existing values of the same dimension.

For example, this new feature helps you to load a provisional balance sheet without breaking it down into subitems that can contain the details of a functional transaction type. The balance carry forward has already filled the opening subitem and this value will not change when the balance sheet is loaded. Instead, the delta is calculated and saved in a standard transaction type.

Here's an example of how you can load data using the new Total Mode option - here, in GRDC Data Mapping.

(1) On the opening balance, consolidation unit "CU001 - France" has a detail of 500 € on partner "CU002 - Germany" for the financial item 121190 - Trade receivables.

(2) Intercompany on Trade receivables is now 700 €, and is imported with GRDC Data Mapping.

(3) With the Total Mode option, 200 € is automatically stored on the variation movement.

The uploaded amount of 700 is handled as a total. A delta amount of 200 between the uploaded amount of 700 on subitem 915 and the already present amount of 500 on subitem 900 is written to subitem 915 for FS item 121190 and partner CU002.

More information: Create Totals for Reported Data with Missing Dimension Values

-
Other innovations

Master data

  • Customer changes of SAP pre-defined selection objects are now supported
  • Parent method change in the Manage Group Structure app for activity-based consolidation of investments

Data collection

  • Multi-tab management in GRDC package
  • Decimal places for quantities based on unit of measure in GRDC package
  • New sign convention in data source import option of GRDC data mapping to adhere to customer sign convention
  • Enhanced documentation for changed treatment of product group in the release universal journal

Data quality and governance

  • New user roles to refine modification and access rights on GRDC data mapping definitions and jobs
  • Ability to generate/save a traceability log for each unique data mapping context in GRDC data mapping
  • New option to overwrite rule control level in line-item validations 
  • Automation of data collection control via control fields substitution in the activity-based consolidation of investments 

Analytics

  • Cross-version validations and dynamic version comparison in analytics

-
More information

  • Group reporting 2508 feature deck
  • Group reporting 2508 help portal
  • Recap of group reporting new features
  • Group reporting community
  • Group reporting customer influence platform

entry.content:
Hi Community,

Here is a blog post of What's New features introduced in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud 2508 edition in the exciting world of SAP Joule.

New use cases now supported

Joule now enables you to view business data of many SAP objects like Process order , Solution order, Enterprise project , Inspection methods , Work Centers and many more...

Update Delivery Date for Purchase Orders

Joule enables you, as a purchaser, to update delivery dates for purchase orders.

For example, when suppliers or equivalent sources inform you of delays or changes, you can use Joule to update the delivery dates with the new information.

Checking sales order fulfillment status

Joule allows you to check whether a sales order's fulfillment is on track and identify the issues that block its fulfillment. For each sales order, Joule can tell whether such issues exist in the order processing phase. If yes, you can display issue details, view possible causes and handling suggestions for each issue, and navigate to related apps.

Expiring Prices Handling

Joule now enables you to manage expiring prices (stored as condition records for pricing in sales) in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. With Joule, you can fetch prices that will expire soon, extend their valid-to dates, and adjust their condition amounts or ratios as you need.

Electronic Document Error Explanations

The Manage Electronic Documents app now enables natural language interaction with Joule, making it easier to understand electronic document exchange errors. You can ask Joule for error explanations and recommended resolution steps. By providing detailed insights, SAP Joule helps you understand the root cause of errors and offers guidance on corrective actions.

There are many more features which can be explored by clicking on the What's New Viewer link https://help.sap.com/docs/joule/capabilities-guide/what-s-new-for-joule-capabilities

entry.title: Understanding CNNs (Convolutional Neural Networks) in under 5 minutes
entry.content:
AI isn’t a dream of the future anymore; it’s all around us. With countless acronyms and concepts to grasp, one you can’t afford to ignore if you want to thrive at consulting is CNN, as it’s reshaping how companies operate and create value in digital economies. 

In this quick guide, we’ll break down what CNNs are, why they matter, and how you can start building the skills to bring this knowledge into your consulting career. 

👉Read through to the end for a resource that will help you take the first step in developing these skills. 

 
So, What is a CNN?  

A CNN (Convolutional Neural Network) is a type of deep brain network that takes hints from how we see. Inspired by the way human brains interpret visual signals, it spots lines, edges, shapes, and patterns. Unlike the “old brain” webs that "see" each bit alone, CNNs can keep track of where things are. This helps them deal with big sets of pics, clips, etc.  

Why Convolutional? Well, the CNNs maintain spatial relationships by using layers called “convolutions” Read more here 

How does a CNN run? (In 3 steps) 

  • The “Convolutional Layer” has three components: the input, which is an image, a kernel (also known as a filter) to detect features like lines, edges, or colors; and an output, which is a feature map summarizing the features found.   
  • The “Pooling Layer”: This layer simplifies the size of the feature map, keeping only the most important information.   
  • The “Fully Connected” Layer takes all that information and uses it to perform classification or regression tasks

What is the difference between CNN and DNN?  

  • A DNN, Deep Neural Network, is an “AI brain web” with lots of links. It sees facts piece by piece, making it good for tasks like seeing pics, hearing speech, & dealing with words.  
  • CNN is a kind of specialized DNN, well-suited for handling image data. The key difference is the ability to apply filters to the input image to extract key features. The information extracted through these layers is then passed to “fully connected layers,” which analyze the features and can generate predictions.   

 

 The big gap is what they do best: DNNs are all-around and work with many kinds of tasks. CNNs are top at jobs that need seeing & knowing visual facts.   

What are CNNs mainly used for

Tasks with Pics  

CNNs work well at sorting, classifying, and detecting objects in images. They have transformed how companies manage visual information: from predictive maintainance tasks in manufacturing to smart supply chain management.  

Dealing with Docs  

CNNs are widely used to automate the extraction of information from documents such as invoices, receipts, and contracts. Instead of relying on manual work or rigid rule-based systems, CNNs can identify and capture key data pointssuch as dates, monetary values, and vendor names with higher accuracy and speed. This also reduces human error, streamlines workflows, and ensures more reliable data for follow-up processes. 

Seeing Things Early  

As said, CNNs are great for looking at things. And they are the perfect ally in enterprise contexts to “see things early”. CNNs can help look at data coming from equipment and machinery, for instance, and detect patterns and anomalies that signal possible failures. This potentially cuts costs & keeps work smooth.  

CNNs in the SAP Ecosystem

The integration of Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) and other advanced AI technologies within SAP Business AI  is reshaping how businesses run and their competitiveness. 

This means clients will increasingly expect you to explain not only the technology, but also the business value it creates. By embedding artificial intelligence into foundational business systems, SAP enables enterprises to enhance operational efficiency, leverage data-driven insights, and drive sustained innovation. As the company continues to evolve its AI offerings, consultants who can connect these capabilities to business outcomes will be the ones helping organizations achieve long-term success in an increasingly competitive marketplace. 

👉If you want to kickstart your career in consulting, explore the SAP Young Professionals Program,  an initiative designed to upskill young talent in SAP’s latest solutions and prepare them as Associate Consultants, ready to deliver value across the SAP ecosystem.
